case.state: Oh! Is this game still not finished? I can wait for a while...

{haiku}To weather the heat
I left my holy clothing,
and embraced summer...

{haiku}As the trees change tones,
so shall I; from red and white
to the night sky's hues.

{haiku}To observe some sights,
even I venture outside...
occasionally.

{haiku}Pursuing what's true
I find myself here today,
in this den of lust.

{haiku}A contest of luck
without winners or losers;
might be amusing.

{haiku}A little card game...
Interesting proposal.
Who knows what might pass?

{haiku} Cobalt skies, blue sea;
between the two, a goddess
in her element.

{haiku}Lone, lost sunflower,
will you survive without light?
Oh, so far from home!
Another version of me? But she is not wearing the shrine maiden outfit...
Oh, huh... Now this is interesting...
Oh, my! You look almost like...

A fish? No, wait, she is just wearing a costume.
{haiku}Disguised as a fish
what secrets are you hiding
behind your faade?
My! I never expected to meet another version of myself... Just what is this place?
Oh, the scion of the Flame Tribe? My, the universe must be a small place after all.

Wha- H-hey!
{haiku}Thundering entrance!
All eyes stare unwavering
at the nude hero.

My, what a flashy entrance...
{haiku} From a tearing void,
reality's sheer fabric
bends to this woman.
Oh, a familiar face? I have traveled so far, and yet I find myself across the usual sights...
Ah, you're here... Today's events need not transpire beyond this place, yes?
What... manner of contraption is this?
Oh? It's good to see a man has deigned to join our gathering. I can certainly appreciate the variety.

{haiku}Five of us, gathered:
unlikely congregation.
The game may start now.
We could start right away, for a more intimate experience... But if someone else wishes to join us, I wouldn't be opposed to the idea.
A minimalistic cast is not necessarily detrimental to this experience, I'd say. If you wish, the game could start right away...
Wait, it is my birthday today! How did they know? Oh, there's even cake...

{haiku}Today's strange playmate
far beyond its habitat
it's a butterfly!
{!reset}How did you even get here, I wonder?

Oh, a butterfly happened to join us?
{haiku}Carried by the winds
no serious contender;
no clothing to shed.
{!reset} Still, it is pretty enough to warrant a spot, I'd say.

Oh, this gives me an idea...
{haiku}To search for flowers
I am revived, freed from sloth;
poetry in bloom.

{haiku}From the tyrant sun
I find solace in shadows,
a shelter for naps.

{haiku}On every day's road
I won't walk alone today,
this autumn's evening.

{haiku}Trudging through the snow
my eyes wander, distracted;
a world painted white.
{!reset}My, I had never done something like this!
...Am I the only one who forgot their swimsuit? Alas, it is too late to change...
Alas, there are only women at this table, Misty. But it would be a shame if you left just because of that...
Fitness routines? Even in a place like this, I can't evade the dreadful prospect of exercising...
Hm... Not bad, not bad at all. You certainly have a good eye for imagery, Binah; if this is your first attempt at haiku, it is far above others I have seen.

Oh, hello Rhajat! I wasn't aware you were going to come here, too.
{haiku}Lucky happenstance,
to reunite with a friend
in a place like this.
Am I dressed for the wrong season? It's fine, I can practice my winter haiku instead.
Oh... will we stand under the raging sun the whole game? Well, at least I'm wearing the proper attire...
Naked from the start? That seems against the spirit of the game...
No clothes? Frankly, ~player~, I think it would be more humiliating if you started with eight layers, and lost them all on purpose...

{haiku}An intimate match;
maybe we'll be cozier
just the three of us.
Oh, a mixed-gender hot spring? Unconventional, but not unexpected, given our circumstances.

Is this where the game is supposed to take place? Hmm...
{haiku}Beauty amidst filth,
power in contradiction;
will it shine brighter?

A remote, isolated place like this one makes for an interesting background...
{haiku}Hidden from mankind,
a forest no one goes to;
untamed, raw beauty.
Oh, were the hot springs occupied? Fine, if I must...
It is only natural for a haiku poet to celebrate the fall season... even if it is in an unconventional manner.

{haiku}Let's commence the game
and throw caution to the winds,
just our clothes at stake.

{haiku}A new beginning:
unknown world, unknown party;
unknown prospects, too.
The next round is already starting? I almost didn't have time to get my drink... oh, and I'll swap ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
So, uh, can I get two more cards too, dealer? No? Ah, then I'll swap ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
I may not be able to discern the numbers in the darkness, but I have a feeling my hand is pretty strong... so I'll keep it as it is.
A-ah, yes, the cards I had forgotten. Uh, ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, please...

{haiku}The end is in sight;
armed with ~cards.text~ new ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, dealer,
this duel shall start.
These are satisfactory. I have no need for more.
If I swapped these, the quality of my hand would only be lower. Hardly a desirable result.
I'll keep what I have, thank you very much.

{haiku}It would be hubris
to aim for more when you have
perfection at hand.

{haiku}I have all I want,
why overreach out of greed?
Zero cards, this time.
I already possess all that is necessary. No extra preparation will be needed.

{haiku}To reach perfection
with no input from my part...
Supernal, indeed!
It's rare that I am satisfied from the first version of one of my poems. But sometimes you end up changing it for the worse, so... I won't switch any of my cards.
I shall stay as I am; I don't want to overreach in pursuit of a lofty, unreachable goal... Better is the enemy of good, after all.
I only need to surpass one of you, yes? Then this hand is suitable enough, without any changes needed.
Wait, it's my turn to switch already? Uhh, let's trade... all of them. Yes, five cards.

{haiku}Dire circumstances
call for desperate measures:
I shall swap five cards.

{haiku}Alarming prospects
If I keep any of this;
I'll swap the whole hand.
I need to scrap the whole hand if I want to stand a chance of not losing...
This hand is simply worthless, dealer. I would like a new one, please.
Frankly, none of this is worth keeping... five cards, please.
Sometimes, things can be unsalvageable... not only poems, but poker hands, too. I'll need a new one...
In times like this, instead of trying to improve what is there, it's better to throw it all away and start anew. Five cards, dealer...
Not a single pair? Ah, just swap all of them...
My, this hand is remarkably terrible! Not a single card of it is worth keeping...

{haiku}This hand is quite close;
no revolution needed.
Just one card should do.
Hmm... for this hand, a very light touch is needed... I'll swap this one, dealer.
This is pretty good already, but it could become even better... One card, please.

{haiku}Sweeping, sudden shifts
sink more ships than they salvage;
a single card, please.
Huh? Oh, sorry, I was distracted... I'll change ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
(Maybe I should aim towards a bad hand... No, I shall let fate keep its course.) Dealer, I request ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.

{haiku}My hand needs some growth
so dealer, I ask of you:
please grant me ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ this time, dealer.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ will hopefully improve my hand.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, please.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ should work. Probably. Maybe. I'm hardly a poker expert, after all.
I think I should be fine with ~cards.text~ new ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.

{haiku}This hand could improve,
but for that, dealer, I'll need
you to switch these ~cards.text~.

{haiku} Keeping this, I see
troubles on the horizon;
I shall seek ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
A poet's eye helps to appreciate beauty anywhere, but to discern the correct play, a gambler's eye is needed... ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, I think?
No haiku this time. Just ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, if you will.
Let me think... ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.

{haiku}To prevent my loss
sacrifices must be made
I'll exchange these ~cards.text~.
Oh, is it the next round already? Give me ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, then.
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~... I hope they are lucky.
I'm more used to fixing haiku verses than poker hands, but I think these ~cards.text~ should go.
Hm... I think these ~cards.text~ are the most disposable.
Each hand, five cards... it feels like rewording a complicated haiku, almost. Oh, I'll have ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.

{haiku}The weak must be culled
for the strong to truly thrive;
these ~cards.text~, I shall swap.

{haiku}In my time of need,
Seeking a better outcome
I require ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.

{haiku}If I ask for ~cards.text~
will I survive one more round?
Only time will tell.
Just give me ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, dealer.

{haiku}Back against the wall;
how many should I ask for?
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ should work fine.
Although it may be unavoidable, I'd rather try to stay in the game as long as possible. ~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ should work towards that end.
Hmm... this hand needs some finishing touches. I'll have ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, dealer.
I think asking for ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ would be the correct move, here.
Keep what works, discard what doesn't... In this case, ~cards.ifplural(these|this)~ ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.

{haiku}Cards that come and go,
a whirlwind of hopes and dreams;
I'll let go of ~cards.text~.
I almost wish the hands were ranked depending on their aesthetic merits, rather than how it currently is... Oh, right, I'll swap ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
Hmm... No, this doesn't quite work... Oh, right, cards! Let's trade back ~cards.ifPlural(these|this)~ ~cards.text~...
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, dealer. I hope these are better...

{haiku} My destiny lies
in mere pieces of paper;
symbols and numbers. {!reset}
Oh, and I will swap ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
I should aim for a pair, at the very least... Let's give back ~cards.ifplural(these|this)~ ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, then.
Ah, the endless pursuit of excellence... Every turn, a new challenge! This time, the answer shall be ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
To rely on divine blessing in a mere game of cards would be squandering such power... ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, dealer.
This periodic repetition of acts... it's almost a ritual of sorts. This time, I shall exchange ~cards.text~.

{haiku}Chosen by fate's whims
a poet, turned duelist:
I'll bring this game's end!
Father is always telling me: "Fortune favors the diligent, Mitama". Looking at these cards, I don't think he's right at all...
I can hardly call myself a poker expert, but at the very least I know when I have good cards. How about you, ~player~?

{haiku}Inspiration struck
a fleeting moment captured
in a paper's folds.

{haiku}A haiku's maxim:
What's good, if brief, two times good;
if bad, not as much.

As a poet, it is my duty not only to write poems, but also to educate those who wish to enter the world of haiku. Watching someone who was a total inept be able to compose a truly moving poem is very satisfying.
If fate keeps bringing me hands like this one, victory may end up becoming a reality... an amusing prospect, isn't it?
It's hard to attain perfection in the first try, but these are pretty close.

{haiku}Fortune smiles on me
and heaps her ample blessings
someone else will strip.
I must admit, I am getting quite caught up in the game. More enjoyable than playing for money, that's for sure.
Haiku poems might be short, but that doesn't mean crafting one is easy. Every word must be carefully considered!

{haiku}Armed with only cards
us fighters shall fiercely clash;
one must always fall...

{haiku}Luck is on my side,
a divine intervention?
If so, I am blessed.

{haiku}Much have I labored,
much have I lost; this hand is
a welcome respite.
I could hardly call myself a combat medic if I couldn't handle a bit of pressure, could I?
I must say, I am not fond of the vapid exchange of pleasantries that social gatherings devolve into. This feels much more genuine, by comparison.
Just when Nohr and Hoshido settled their differences, they had to wage war again against their mutual foe... must the fighting never end?
Not only the contents of a poem must be carefully measured; the calligraphy needs to be suitably graceful, as well.
I may have lost my gloves, but I still have a couple of tricks under my sleeves...
I bet Soleil would have a great time flirting with all the girls here. I should mention this place to her, then.
If Nina ever came here... she would probably faint, with all the men getting naked together...
It's not often that I find myself in the company of so many people... I miss the quiet, somewhat.
Tsk... I can't come up with anything...
Few things can compare to the joy of taking a midday nap. You should try it for yourselves.
It's unlikely that you can grasp perfection on your first try. That's why it's important to keep writing.
I better write down some of the haiku I have come up with. I always forget them otherwise...
It is not often that I have to settle for mediocrity.

{haiku}Much like life itself
card games rely on one's hand
more than one's choices.
It is said that a picture is worth a thousand words... And yet, a truly skilled poet needs but seventeen syllables to recreate one.
You never know when and where inspiration will strike... That's why I make sure to carry brush and paper anywhere I go.
I prefer napping at my own room, but as long as I have my pillow with me, anywhere is fine. Once, I ended up sleeping at the prison, even.
These... could use some improvement. Alas, I don't have the chance to do so.

{haiku}Just a pair of cards;
with no major surprises,
it will be enough.
Hmm... nothing to write home about. Or, at all.

{haiku}Creating from aught;
that would be remarkable
were I capable...

{haiku}Think you know my hand?
Everything I say could be
nothing but a bluff...
I tend to strive for perfection, but I find myself a bit pressed for time here...
In the Deeprealm in which I grew up, time flows at a different pace compared to Hoshido and Nohr. I wonder if the same applies here...
Hmm... I hope fortune plays nice this time.

{haiku}How much is enough?
The answer to that question
is, hopefully, this.

{haiku}Leaving all to fate;
what exhilarating ride!
I am but a fare.

{haiku}We can't help but play
life itself, a game of cards:
winners and losers.
Fate can be quite tricky. It is immovable, but it can also be quite difficult to predict... Sometimes you don't know what will happen until the very moment it occurs.

{haiku}One more step of this
inscrutable path I walk;
I shall not stumble.

{haiku}I go for a walk,
gray skies beyond my window;
hoping for no rain.
I think this is the longest period of time I have ever spent exposed in this manner... Strange, how nudity has become little more than a transitory period.
Kings ranking over queens... so it's like Hoshido, at least in terms of succession.
In Nohr, men and women hold no difference when it comes to entering the throne. If this game equaled kings to queens, it would be a bit more confusing.
The ambiguity of these cards... charming, is it not?
Teleporters, bridges, bottomless pits... recently, I've dealt with so many of them that I have a newfound respect for solid ground.
The landscape of V- um, of that place, is unlike any I have ever seen described. The land itself seems to have been torn by some unknown, titanic force...
That third kingdom's very name is cursed; whoever says its name beyond its borders will die. Even here, I'd rather not risk it.

{haiku}Fate is against me,
yet seeing the ambiance, I
can't complain too much.

{haiku}Must I always lose?
Although inexperienced,
I am not alone...
The more you write, the more proficient you become. Perhaps the same is true for strip poker...

{haiku}Armed with naught but faith
I await the foreordained;
a not so harsh fate.

{haiku}A four of a kind?
What an unprecedented,
yet convenient turn!

{haiku}Oh, how unlucky...
I may have to strip! Truly,
a tremendous loss.

{haiku}Surge of misfortune;
time for Mitama to think:
what should I strip next?
Just so that people know, I didn't bring my festal here. That means, if someone scraps their knee, or something like that, I'm not healing them.
*yawn* I'm a bit tired... maybe if I hadn't stayed up all night writing haiku... no, I can hardly miss my most productive moment of the day.

Most of what I write
is simply not good enough
and ends up scrapped.
Like this one poem. It doesn't even have the correct amount of syllables...
Back at the base, we share the chores, like cooking and such, among ourselves. Mother says it helps foster the bonds between us; I say it's really tiresome.
In addition to my poems, I also dabble in chigiri-e, an art form that consists in creating images with pieces of torn paper. Maybe I can find a use for these cards, after all...

People at the base keep waking me up all the time. It's always: "Mitama, there are injured people that need your attention!"; "Mitama, why are you asleep at midday?"; "Mitama, don't snore at the war council!" Sleep should be sacred!
Admittedly, these cards do have interesting designs... but that's about it.
Luckily, there is no money at stake in this game... I already spent this month's salary in writing paper.
I'm not terribly concerned about each and every little misfortune that befalls me. Luck tends to even itself out in the end.
Can I take a nap for a while? No? Oh well...
Yeah, my cards are just dreadful. So dreadful, in fact, that there's no point to even pretend they are not.
Hmm... the game would be pretty boring if I always won, wouldn't it? And besides, losing is hardly an unacceptable outcome...

{haiku}Is this bad karma?
Perhaps I am too attached
to worldly desires.
We are all victims of fate. Some of us simply accept it.
As of late, Father has been pushing me to get archery lessons, "so that I can defend myself properly". Can't he see I'm busy napping?

{haiku}This hand is a joke!
I can almost hear Father
laughing at my luck.
Sometimes I think of a great idea for a haiku, and then I become distracted and it vanishes, as if it never existed in the first place. Truly vexatious.
Somehow, I managed to make my hand even worse than it originally was...

{haiku}These cards are no good.
Unfortunate Mitama...
or fortunate you?
Now that I think about it, maybe I didn't have to take off my gloves. I could have left them on... and nothing else.
Well, someone will be happy with this.
Barring a miracle, it will be my turn next. Fortunately for me, I seem to attract miracles, so...
Losing here is all a matter of luck, and I am confident enough about my body to not be ashamed by nudity. If I had to read my old poems, though... now that would be embarrassing.

{haiku}Whatever comes next,
I shall peacefully await,
eyes fully open. {!reset}
That is the duty of a poet, is it not?
I'm afraid I dedicated too much time to writing down my haiku, and not enough to selecting the right cards.
Hm. The closer I find myself to the forfeit, the more my hesitation vanishes... with its place filled by lust instead.
The Nohrian army also employs healers in their ranks. But they mount horses... I can't imagine myself healing and riding at the same time.
Mother being connected to the royal families of both Nohr and Hoshido means I am, technically, royalty. But I'd rather dedicate myself to writing than deal with the court and its issues...
Sometimes I also have to heal the people who fight in the arena. It's non-lethal, true, but it's still so much effort... And all of it, over mere food or gems.
I wouldn't mind a chance to lose some of my clothing... this place is simply too warm for my usual attire.

...Hmm.
{haiku}The sea's crashing waves
captured in a drinking glass;
a dance in turquoise. {!reset}
Unlike the sea, though, this tastes between sweet and sour.
My, the mood of this game is particularly blithe today... I shall accommodate my haiku accordingly.
Oh, me? I'm Mitama, haiku poet and dreamer... and combat healer, at least for the moment. It is nice to meet you all.

Fret not, your backside is perfectly unmarred. Beautiful, even.
{haiku}Two round, perfect spheres
rivaling the skies above;
the moon stares in awe.

{haiku}Miraculous bloom!
In this barren, empty room,
new life emerges.

Please don't, Jill.
{haiku} Filthy, acrid smoke
pervading the once-pure air,
drowning all colors...
Personally, I'm not fond of smoke. But given our location, it's not too bothersome...
If you are talking about Corrin and Azama, then yes. At least, that's true for me...
That is also the case for me. Admittedly, it is hard to think of having different parents to the ones I have...
Oh, but Setsuna's hair color would look good on us, would it not? Though inheriting her penchant for falling into traps could be troublesome...
Right... After all, even our poetic aspirations emerged as a result of serendipity...
And yet, from the moment we entered this game, we became separate entities. You could say we were born mere minutes ago!
Wait... if we are minutes old, are we even allowed here to begin with?
Hmm... I didn't meet my little brother until recently, Nagisa. I was often curious about him, so I can share the sentiment.

A nice poem? Oh, of course...
{haiku} Begging for release,
a lewd image is produced;
even lewder sounds.
I don't have any clear prospects, honestly. Fate is unpredictable, but as long as I can write, I'll be fine.
Hmm... no, I don't see any scars. It's possible that it might have faded with the passage of time, though.
Nightlife? That sounds like the opposite of a good time, frankly. I think I'd rather stay at home, writing by the moonlight.

Well, it would be a waste to dress for the occasion and then not set foot on the sea...
{haiku}Slowly, I approach
the moon the ocean reflects,
alone with the waves.
Pink hair and star-shaped pupils... It would appear we all share the same parents, do we not?
Given our similarities, is it safe to assume that we have had identical life experiences, as well?
Isn't that a poster of you on the wall, Rin? Seems like whoever lives in this room is a fan of yours...
Oh my, that outfit's backside is even more revealing than the front...

Well, I am a good cook... but, frankly, I don't see an auspicious future, were we to marry...
{haiku} Two lazy maidens
living under a shared roof?
Disaster beckons.
I'm pretty sure that's just cheating... why do you insist in prolonging the inevitable so much?

Ah, the very image of a shrine maiden, unfolded before my eyes...
{haiku} Under her garments,
just as tradition dictates,
a wrapped chest awaits...
By wearing modern underwear, I wished to commemorate a special occasion. Ironically, I would have stood out more with a sarashi like yours, Reimu.
Hmm... I would say you are already doing pretty well. Strip poker is a good way to expose your best qualities, after all.

Sound advice. I make sure to follow it, of course. {haiku}
Wind, rain, heat or snow;
none can separate a brush
from a poet's hands.
In my limited experience, that third kingdom I mentioned would be the most dangerous place I've been to. Unstable ground, shade-like, aggressive figures... even its name is cursed.
Writing when stuck? Hm... that just leads to uninspired poems. Not something I would personally recommend.
Writing dialogue for characters? Huh, I didn't know you wrote plays too, Monika.
My, such a haiku explosion! Perhaps you'll share this newfound passion with the rest of your crew as well...

Oh, you too have been inspired to compose poetry, Meia?
{haiku}Through cold, empty space,
reaching two newly-formed blooms,
a ray of sunlight.
My apologies, but you will receive no special treatment. We can celebrate once the game is over and all is revealed instead.
Oh? Well, as long as you remember to spend some time with your friends...
I must admit, I feel similarly attached to my writing implements. After using them for so long, my poems feel soulless if I write with anything else.
Oh, a gimmick? Well, since you two came to the game together, maybe you'll do the forfeit together, too?

Well, I don't keep a journal itself, but most of the haiku I write are about my experiences and feelings... {haiku}
To pour your own soul
not to people, but paper
is it strange, truly?
Oh, sometimes I cook for the army when it's my turn to do so. I'm actually decently skilled at it, if I say so myself.
Hmm... I'm not too fond of weapons. If I were to choose something, it would be this brush.
Foo-rance? I have never heard of such a kingdom...
Conning people who need to be cured?! That would be... too heinous!
I once accompanied a ninja on his quest to retrieve a magical scroll from the ruins of a shrine. Long story short, by the time we arrived, the curse was already inert.
Oh, I do know someone like that... Selkie is always playing or jumping around. Honestly, it can be tiring to just watch her, sometimes...

Well, I see no point in concealing my interests, either.
{haiku}Poetry and naps;
innocent, joyful treasures:
what more could I need?
I have never taken anybody's life... and I hope I never have to. I am a healer, first and foremost.
Well, people always say I am lazy, but I tend to be either in the process of creating new haiku, or recovering my energy for what is to come. Does that fit your question?
While I'm not sure whether "tough" would be the correct word to use, Rhajat has proven herself to be far kinder than the rumors say. I highly treasure our friendship!

Personally, I prefer to keep it simple.
{haiku}Fresh-harvested rice:
Pickled plum placed over it,
heaven in a bowl.
I can't say, really. Insomnia has never been a problem for me. If anything, I struggle to stay awake...

For me, the stars are an endless source of inspiration... {haiku}
Stars in the night sky,
imperishable watchers:
do you cry, or laugh?

I very much doubt so, Takatoshi. The experiences we go through are what makes us who we are.
{haiku}In another world,
Mitama, not a poet?
Inconceivable!
Ah, gossip... in that regard, I would be of little help; I simply am not much of a social person.
Given your penchant for placing yourself at risk, I would say... hunter, or something along those lines.
All that work... so in the end, not even the gods can escape the rules imposed upon them by the universe. Somehow, that is reassuring.
Fortunately, I am unharmed. Although I do hope that Aimee doesn't plan on taking the rest of her clothes in the same manner...
Oh, you will take care of the healing, Fina? That's good; I wouldn't want to exert myself in my day off.
Well, um... when I was young, Mother used to hold my head on her lap and sing me lullabies... so something like that would be nice.

My closest friend is Rhajat... we just seem to instinctively understand each other.
I didn't think I could have such a meaningful relationship with another person!
Hmm... Ku-ma-to-ra. Four syllables, not too unwieldy. It's a beautiful name, so it would be a shame if it were truncated.

Personally, I can't think of a worse punishment than being forced to spend every moment embroiled in work.
{haiku}Pointless, endless chores
my soul slowly languishes,
buried underneath.
Huh... To find one's place in the world is perhaps the hardest task a person can undertake. Doing so is admirable, Taiyaki Girl.

{haiku} How loud is this crow,
mistaking its shrill cawing
for melodic song?
Oh, um... I think being under the care of a strong, experienced man would be nice...
A pet... No, it would be too much trouble to take care of one. And I hardly want distractions while I'm writing.
Unnatural? This hair color is the same one Mother has, I'll have you know...
Well, my brush is starting to show signs of wear. It may be time to buy a new one... but I don't think that was what you were thinking about.

I may not have much dating experience, but I do have ideas...
{haiku}Cuddling together
under a blanket of stars;
two lovers, as one.
{!reset}Doesn't that sound romantic?
Well, it may not be the reason why I write, but having people admire my poems is always encouraging.
Huh... I'm jealous, Senko. 800 years worth of naps...
Oh, perhaps this meeting is a reward for all the toils I have endured throughout all my years serving the gods...
Changing careers on a whim? Even if I weren't tied up at the moment, it would be too sudden of a shift to truly consider...
I don't have a particular goal in mind beyond enjoying the views this place has to offer. And, of course, the inspiration derived from them...
Sadly, I do not have many experiences about love, let alone complex ones...
Well, I know some healing magic, but I am not interested in the study of magic. Just on its practical applications.
Oh, I didn't take you for the type who lets their emotions flow into verses... But the result is undoubtedly good, especially for your first foray in the world of poetry.
Oh, that wasn't bad at all! And I am honored to have served as a guiding wind, as well.
Is it really your birthday? Hmm... seems strange to spend it in a place like this.
Hmm... I wouldn't say I am attached to a specific meal in the same way I am attached to haiku, but I am fond of rice-based dishes.
Having children... is not something I have planned for, at least in the short term. It is a very big responsibility, after all.
Well, I have never consciously seduced anyone... but I'd wager someone like you could charm almost any man, provided you displayed a minimum level of attention on them.
Ah, thankfully she wasn't completely unreasonable... Let's continue, shall we? With less magic attacks, hopefully...
Only six hours of sleep? That seems too little to me. I'd have to compensate with a lot of naps for it.

Well, I have traveled from afar, too... Actually, most of us come from different worlds, don't we?
{haiku}On a blank canvas
universes coalesce
to build something new.
To be without temptation is to be without desire. As long as it doesn't become all-consuming, it is a fairly forgivable, I'd say.
Well, of course. After all, my writing equipment doesn't replenish itself. Sometimes, I spend the whole day in search for the ideal brush...
A thousand gold? That's barely enough for a Sun Festal... some quality paper, perhaps?
Oh, it's simply "gold". I don't think our worlds differ much from one another...
Not really. I have yet to meet someone with similar poetic interests, sadly.
My friend Rhajat often talks about her research on summoning Faceless. I... don't quite share her enthusiasm.
If they want to be left alone, shouldn't you respect their wishes? Honestly, some people have no respect for boundaries...

Whenever I have a moment to spare, I dedicate it to my beloved haiku.
{haiku}A thousand hours spent
in pursuit of purity,
time never wasted.
Hmm... in my case, it would be one of the romance novels a friend lent me. To think that mere prose could be so touching...
I'd rather stay where I am, thank you very much, Arash. Why go through the troubles of transportation, when I can already enjoy the wonders of exotic locations through literature?
Now that I think about it, a cross of images and words is a good description of haiku... It would seem as if we are similar in that regard, Arash.
Quite often, actually. After all, it is the quietest moment of the day and, thus, the ideal opportunity to write poems.
Oh, but there are countless types of flowers, each with a charm of its own. It would be cruel to choose only one...
I can't say I ever have met one, Arle... they belong to the realm of fantasy where I come from.

Hmm... I'm not that attached to my appearance, but I have always been fond of my eyes.
{haiku} Towards the night sky
a matching, captive gaze stares;
inherited stars.
For a poet like me, a good dream is one in which inspiration strikes. Then, when awake, I translate those ideas into poetry...
Actually, it's rare for me to have bad dreams. And when I do, I soon forget them anyway. I'm fortunate in that regard...
Not really, Beatrix. Where I am from, the main threat is a dragon, fallen into madness. Frankly, we already have enough to worry about...
To change oneself? Hmm... I suppose it would be convenient to become stronger without needing to put time or effort into exercising...
Well, I have seen karakuri puppets on occasion, but they differ much from you. Particularly in their verboseness.
I can't say I have ever heard about that sport, Wheatley. But it does sound barbaric...
Hm... To begin with, my world seems more... rustic than yours. There are many words you use that I don't recognize.
Considered? In my case, it's a reality; the Deeprealm I was raised in was a different world, compared to where I currently reside.
In my opinion, the most beautiful images come from nature. A field covered by all manner of wildflowers, a pristine, gleaming night sky...
For my nightly sleep, I strip to my undergarments, but for napping, I usually stay in the clothes I'm wearing. It's a spontaneous act, you see.
I once tried some chili from the mess hall, but I didn't enjoy the meal that much. I prefer sweet food.
Not really. I'm afraid my talents are limited to the written word.
Hmm... I'm more confident in the power of my words than in my raw strength. And if someone refuses to listen to reason, I will not force them to.
Lately, I have been eating a lot of candy. The confections Asugi gave me are simply exquisite!
Oh, not at all! In fact, it is the first time I attend this establishment.
Ah, recently I have been reading a romance novel a friend lent me, Falling for Her in a Fortnight. It's not my usual fare, but it is enjoyable nonetheless.
Sadly, no. Either I'm writing poems, for which I don't need to focus, or I'm suffering through chores, something I'd rather avoid...
N-No, I haven't... And besides, this is more intimate than simple exhibitionism, don't you think?
Not really, card games are not my usual choice of recreation... Although I made sure to know the rules, at very least.
My main reason is to personally witness remarkable events, and to fuel my poetic muse. It's actually rare for me to venture outside, but for the sake of art, sacrifices must be made.
While I'm moved by artistic interests, I cannot deny my other, more worldly desires... and this place can sate both, Fluttershy.

Not really, Galatea. On one hand, having your work criticized is a mark of success, and you can improve from criticism; on the other hand, the prospect of receiving a caustic review can be daunting...

Well, I tend to keep to myself, so I can't say I have ever made any enemies.
{haiku}To live quietly,
without trampling on others;
watcher's privilege.
Not really. I'm a simple person with simple aspirations; there is nothing for me to hide, honestly.

You probably already know by this point, but...
{haiku}All for poetry;
to chase, unwaveringly,
the star I follow.
Interesting question... Well, in my case, I'd say I value truth more. After all, I encapsulate and emulate reality through my poems.
Huh, you have to study to change classes? Can't you just use a Master Seal and be done with it?
My passion for haiku goes beyond the one for a mere hobby, it is akin to a guiding principle... Oh, and I am also fond of taking naps.
Yeah... Like "hootenanny", for example. It sounds as though it referred to a gathering of owls...
"Treat others as you would like to be treated." Flawed though that assertion may be, following it would surely result in a better world. Wars would disappear overnight, for example.
A haiku poet can't be partial to any one season, Arash. Each one brings a different set of natural marvels, after all...
I'm not sure, Nadeshiko... Cooking a proper meal takes too much time. Even though I'm not bad at cooking myself, I'd rather have others do it instead.
Hmm... for me, personality would be much more important than someone's physical appearance. A relationship with someone whose presence you loathe simply has no future.
Oh, my name means "honored soul", apparently. Surprisingly thoughtful, coming from Father...
Hmm... For better or for worse, I have never competed against anyone... although poetry is hardly a cutthroat field, Kaz.
Given my lack of experience, I don't expect my input to be all that useful... but I hope you have better luck in the future.
Hmm... I was born on June 26th... If I remember correctly, that means my astrological sign is Cancer.
Although I have spent most of my life in a Deeprealm, I hail from the kingdom of Hoshido. Perhaps you have heard of it?
Hmm... While it is not something I would personally go for, I think it suits you, Lyralei.
While I wouldn't say I love nature, it is a quintessential source of inspiration for a poet, and so I cannot in good conscience avoid it.
Oh? I wasn't aware people shaved down there in the first place. How curious.

I certainly do, Lyralei...
{haiku} Behind closed curtains,
a shadow of temptation;
object of desire...

Ah... when I am brooding, I tend to retreat inwards into my poetry.
{haiku} With this brush of mine,
hardships convert into words;
sorrows into ink.
Unfortunately, I lack the access to such extravagant means of transport, Kaz. On the rare occasions where I venture outside, I do so on foot.
I still don't know how to swim, Mary. Such outdoors activities are not for me, in any case.
Because, regardless of your own perspective, you are still constrained by the thoughts and actions of others. To borrow your own words: "Freedom is a spook".
Ah, I am afraid I don't have any personal powers. Still, I am a serviceable healer, if that counts...
I might be a healer, but the last thing I want right now is even more work, Nagamimi. I shall respectfully decline.

Pure chance, Nagamimi. These are simply the clothes of a Hoshidan shrine maiden.
{haiku}White and red garments
worn out of duty, not will;
fitting, nonetheless.
In my world, there aren't many dragons left. Hardly a "plague", as you put it... N-not that a humble shrine maiden like me would know much about dragons, haha...
There is a rare kind of sword, called "wyrmslayer", that is particularly lethal to those with dragon blood. I- I mean, they- have to be very careful when facing such a weapon.

Ah... I don't seek any goal in particular. All I truly wish for is a peaceful life, with sleep and poetry in equal measure.
{haiku}Swept between the waves,
a future cannot be seen
beyond the dark clouds.
Haah... Sadly, Nanoko, some events must be experienced in person in order to be properly comprehended. However, should you wish to remedy that...
Hmm... while I have bathed alongside others in the hot springs at the base, nothing untoward has ever happened. Hot springs are meant for relaxation, after all.

Where I come from, small realms like this one are simply common knowledge, Neptune.
{haiku}Whether large or small,
every place is connected;
tapestry of worlds.
Oh, I hail from the kingdom of Hoshido, which has a long and rich history. In particular, I am a devoted practitioner of its poetic forms.
Well, walking is too tiresome, horses are too strange, and pegasi fly too high... Perhaps something akin to a Witch's teleportation?
Have you tried napping, Heris? It is a good chance to get more sleep; I try to do it as often as I can.
Hmm... to me, a friend is someone with whom I have a commonality, even if it is small. After all, there can't be any meaningful conversation between two diametrically opposed people.
If that is how you want to see this game, I won't stop you, but I don't think the rest of us share that opinion.
Oh, are you offering to pay? In that case, I shall gladly accept.
Haah... While it would be wonderful to save everyone, that is simply unrealistic. Part of a healer's job is to identify those who cannot be saved.
Actually, there has been a song like that going around camp. I believe its lyrics were: "You are the ocean's gray waves..."
And send my own children to a Deeprealm, too? No, thank you.

It would be foolish to not acknowledge the beauty right in front of me, would it not?
{haiku}It is not the wind
that moves my heart, but the shine
of your golden mane.
Indeed, you show potential! I see no value in empty platitudes, just so you know...
As a fellow writer, I wholeheartedly recommend to intimately familiarize yourself with the classics. To that end, recently I have been perusing a collection of Issa's haiku.

Sometimes, it's too obvious who will lose the round...
{haiku}A petrified face,
tinctured with ghostly pallor
as defeat draws near...
Indeed. One version of Mother was already shocking enough, and now I have to contend with two...

{haiku}Under the night sky
skyclad I find myself now.
Will you observe me?
Incidentally, by which manner did the rest of you arrive to this place? It was easy for me to go through the Dragon's Gate, but maybe it was more complicated for you.
(By the way, ~player~... if you want to see the funny haiku, pick another April fools character alongside me, okay?)

{haiku}What gorgeous image!
Our naked bodies compete
with the moon's allure.
Perhaps we should invite her to join us. After all, if she has been watching us, it's only fair that we see her strip as well...
The moon is beautiful tonight, isn't it? Many haiku have been composed under the influence of a moon like this one...

{haiku}Soft grass grazes me,
nature and poet, as one;
a small but pure joy.

{haiku}Sandals discarded
I stand pleasantly barefoot
smooth sand under me.
Now that you can see all of me, I think it's only fair to show both sides. Which one do you prefer, hmm?

Oh, don't worry. After the game ends, I'll share my cake with everyone else.
{haiku}Far too much for one,
birthday cakes, just as birthdays,
are meant to be shared.

{haiku}For us defenseless,
victory and defeat hinge
on one last coin flip.
{!reset} Regardless of the outcome, this has been a truly enjoyable experience!

{haiku}Two trucks, having sex.
Such passion, I can't withstand.
Two trucks, having sex.

{haiku}Sleepin' in your bed
an imperceptible man.
Who you gonna call?

{haiku}Free will is a myth.
Religion is a cheap joke.
We are naught but memes.

{haiku}Think Three Houses rules?
How about a true good game?
Go play Fates instead.

{haiku}Surreptitiously
I opened one more time the
refrigerator.

{haiku}Time, human construct:
The past is far behind us,
there's no future yet.

{haiku}Oh, the misery...
everybody wants to be...
e, e, e, e, e.

{haiku}Subbing or dubbing;
eternal pointless debate:
no side will be moved.

{haiku}So many bodies
floating limp in the water
you can't recognize.

{haiku}You can't run, can't hide;
I am watching, behind you:
I live in your walls.
I must admit, it has become somewhat difficult to focus on the cards next to such a performance...
A ladies-only table? I had hoped for some more variety...
Now that I have come this far, I find myself a bit invested in the outcome of the game...
You have done great thus far... surely you can defeat a poor, lone shrine maiden?

{haiku}In terms of meter,
five, seven and then five more:
so a haiku goes.

{haiku}In the moonlit night
a friendly competition
no losers in sight.

{haiku} Doomed to lose, I wait
for the executioner
to lower its blade!
{!reset} Such powerlessness...
Where I am from, two kingdoms control the vast majority of the land: Nohr and Hoshido. Fierce enemies, until recently...
But unbeknownst to us, there was a third kingdom behind the conflict that plagued us, plotting from behind the scenes...
It's probably a good thing there are no familiar faces at this table. Imagine the awkwardness of the day after...

{haiku}By drawing my gaze
at the same sky of my youth
I felt I was old.
{!reset}I should write this down...
Wait, am I the only one here who doesn't shave down there? I wasn't aware I was in the minority in this regard.
Hmm... A secluded location like this... It gives this whole situation an air of mystery, don't you think?

{haiku}So many weapons
but none of them are for me:
a staff, all I need.
Did you know about the weapon triangle? Apparently, some weapons have an advantage against others... but I can never remember exactly how it goes.

{haiku}Sword and katana
side by side as companions;
reminder of home.
Couldn't we have played elsewhere? I came here to escape battle for a while, not to be reminded of it...
Frankly, dust and cobwebs in an armory is a good sign; it means that the weapons are ready, but do not need to be used.
I'd much rather battle with cards or words than with weapons, but no many other people share my preferences... It's a shame, really.
At the base, we usually purchase our own equipment. Can you believe it? Imagine all the paper I could buy with the money I'd save...
A library... strange place for a strip poker game. I wonder if they have haiku books...
The library back at the shrine was much more modest than this one. Hehe, I might even find a haiku book I haven't already read!
I wonder if I'll be able to stay here after the game for a while to read at my leisure. A week or so should suffice for some light reading.

This place is heaven to me: {haiku}
No park or meadow
can compete with the allure
of paper and shelves.
With how many books and poems I have at my room, it somewhat resembles this place... although here everything is much more orderly, I must admit.
So, whose birthday is it? Any of yours? It's not mine, that's for sure...
Spending this much time outside with so little clothing is not one of my usual activities... I hope I don't get sunburned...
A library... strange place for a strip poker game. I wonder if they have haiku books...
The library back at the shrine was much more modest than this one. Hehe, I might even find a haiku book I haven't already read!
I wonder if I'll be able to stay here after the game for a while to read at my leisure. A week or so should suffice for some light reading.

This place is heaven to me: {haiku}
No park or meadow
can compete with the allure
of paper and shelves.
With how many books and poems I have at my room, it somewhat resembles this place... although here everything is much more orderly, I must admit.
I must say, the view here is simply gorgeous. Who knew a strip poker game could have such an amazing backdrop?
I once got roped by a painter to accompany him to a lake similar to this one. It was a productive day... Nature is truly evoking to artists like us, after all.
I would make for a dreadful ruler... I can't even keep my own room in order.

{haiku}O pitiful kings,
heavy is a crown's burden:
I'd much rather write.
A throne is not nearly comfortable enough for me... maybe with a couple of pillows?
After the game, we could huddle together in the sofa and watch the fire... It might be a bit small for all of us, but that only means we will be closer, don't you think?
It's still anyone's game... Who will claim the throne for themselves?

Throne aside, the view from this place is quite interesting... {haiku}
Through the stained window
an alternate universe;
strange, distorted hues...
I have a friend that absolutely adores dark, eerie places like this forest. Maybe if I tell her about this place, she'll come here one day?
I hope the ghosts don't bother us too much... so far, they have been content with just watching.
Recently, I have gained a newfound appreciation for spectral locations like this one, thanks to a particular friend of mine... Beauty is not limited to tame, sunny meadows, after all.
The fog, the phantoms, the shadows in these crooked, ominous trees... It's almost as if the forest itself were alive.
The collection of topics in this library seems much more adventurous than the one the shrine's library had. Perhaps I could learn one or two new things...
Looking at the spines of these books, I see many unfamiliar words. "BDSM", "Futanari"... I wonder what they mean.
A theater stage... I don't see myself reciting my poetry to an audience. Ironic, given my current activity.
A dark, foreboding curtain... aren't you curious as to what lies behind it?
All the world is a stage... yet who are the ones watching this play?
The music is too loud, the lights are too dazzling, and there is a gaggle of voyeurs right behind us... I fail to see the appeal of this place.
You can learn a lot about someone by examining their taste in literature... For example, whoever lives here is probably illiterate.

{haiku}A lone, white flower;
the only decoration
this plain room allows.
From what I know, these elevated beds are usual in Nohr... personally, I'm more used to sleeping in a futon.
I'd have a hard time believing someone truly lives here. This room is too clean, too spartan for that.
I used to rely on candles to stave off the darkness, until a friend provided me with a magic charm that generates light. Now, not even the murkiest nights prevent me from writing.
Ah, a mansion... such luxuries might entice some people, but I wouldn't trade my humble shrine for them.
An ambient of Nohrian refinement... Not too different to the one in which Mother was raised, although hers was a castle.
In the end, no amount of money can buy peace and tranquility. Living in a place like this one is overrated, frankly.
Does no one bother cleaning this place? Ah, I thought the owners had higher standards than this...
While my room may be messy, this place is absolutely filthy. At this point, even I would be motivated enough to start cleaning.
I've never been fond of games... Since youth, all my spare time has been dedicated to more important endeavors.
Is this truly how people in the future will spend their time? Staring at bright, colorful, yet artificial boxes...
If mankind loses sight of nature, then it has lost sight of what true beauty is like.
"Space flight..." What a lousy imitation. The night sky is far more fascinating than this hollow picture.
Isn't it ironic that, amidst these technological inventions, all we need to amuse ourselves are cards and nudity?

I've always preferred baths to showers...
{haiku}Alongside the dirt,
all the worldly worries fall
from my weary soul.
It was nice of them to leave the condoms, but we probably will have no use from them. Still, it might be interesting to follow their silent advice...
What an odd assortment of items... I haven't gone to many birthday parties, but none of them had prophylactics next to the cake.

Beyond the immediate, this location is quite charming, isn't it?
{haiku}Clear skies and grasslands
as far as the eye can see,
a promise of peace.
It was kind of them to provide contraception, but they needn't have bothered... I already came prepared for such an eventuality.
While I would prefer a hot spring, a bath is fine as well. The most important thing is to be able to sit and relax, after all.
Pleasant though it might be, a hot spring is dangerous to fall asleep in... long exposure to heat can be harmful. And yes, I speak from experience.
We have a hot spring of our own at the base. It's quite crowded, even though men and women bathe at separate times.
Personally, I prefer bathing in the middle of the night. There's less people at that time, and I can stargaze to my heart's content.
I don't dislike the beach itself... I just wish the temperature was slightly colder, the water slightly less salty and the sand slightly less coarse.
Unpleasant though it may be, even I must admit the view is truly gorgeous... the combination of the sand, sea and sky is quite picturesque.
I didn't expect the sea to have such a piercing smell... it almost has a personality of its own.

{haiku}Shameless revelry;
shyly peeking behind glass,
a silent moon stares.
How dizzying... it's as if the world itself was poorly drawn here... as farfetched as it sounds.
This particular part of the universe seems particularly unstable. Let's hope it doesn't collapse onto itself.

{haiku}Waving, crooked lines;
a portent of levity
once every year.
Stars in the curtains, hmm... I like the decor of this place.
Only three poor books? Multiply that number by fifty or so, and you'll have a close approximation of what my own room is like.
This place truly has a pleasant color palette, doesn't it? Even the skies themselves conspire to create a pleasant atmosphere...
A soft, fuzzy stuffed animal... it has been a long time since I slept alongside one. Alas, I fear I misplaced my own somewhere.
A stuffed animal... I think? I have never seen anything like that before...

An urban garden...
{haiku}Between tall buildings,
a small piece of paradise
stolen from concrete.
*yawn* That bed is looking more appealing by the moment... and not just for resting.
So many contraptions I don't recognize... I wonder what their purposes are.
I do like the presence of greenery, but this isn't what I had in mind...
If whoever set this room liked green so much, they could have brought some natural grass.
Relegated to a hidden corner... I suppose our activities are far too lewd to be allowed in a classroom.
A warm fireplace, a comfortable couch and sufficient reading material... I could spend a week here!

Oh, the snow is so pretty...
{haiku}Soft, short-lived snowflakes
fight against the raging winds,
dancing in twilight...
Are those presents for us? If so, I hope mine isn't socks again... Father's sense of humor can be strange at times.
What beverage is that on the table? It smells very tempting...
Mother once told me how she once faced against enemies who were hidden under a blanket of snow... I must admit, it makes me slightly paranoid.
I'd almost feel bad, defiling a hot spring in this manner... were I not aroused by the prospect.
I'm not a fan of most social activities. This is the first time I venture into a bar... and I chose quite an unconventional one.
Between all this gray, this poor potted plant almost seems out of place. Truly, it's fighting a losing battle...
While romance might be nice to experience, I wouldn't go out of my way to seek for a soulmate... If it happens, it happens.
Strange, I thought this place was meant to celebrate lust, not love...
The decoration in the wall leave no room for discussion as to their intention. Still, it's too heavy-handed for my taste.
This room is ripe with the scent of love... Could this be where I meet my destined partner? Heh, probably not.
At the base, there's this old man who "predicts" the romantic affinity between two people... The results are amusing, if nothing else.
Familiar faces, familiar scenery... It's as if I didn't move from my starting position at all.
I had never been on top of such a high building... My, it's as if we were higher than the mountains themselves...
Ever since we went to that nameless kingdom, I have developed a mild fear of heights. Luckily, this place was built with safety in mind.
The amount of onlookers is less than ideal... but if they limit themselves to watching, I can go along with it.
Ah, the artificial lights of this city have drowned the night. A small tragedy in the grand scheme of things, but it still hurts.
Wait, is that someone's underwear, left forgotten? So someone other than us had a similar idea...

The fall season has a aura of mystery around it, doesn't it? Mayhap due to the lessened daylight...
{haiku} Shorter days, cold nights;
towards the looming shadows
no one dares to go...
I didn't plan for this, but this hat provides a much appreciated shelter from the sun. Perhaps I should wear it more often?
Let's see how much I remember about the weapon triangle... lances beat swords... axes beat lances... but do axes beat tomes? Ah, I just need to heal people anyways. It's not like this applies to me.
Hmm... probably the way the sea merges with the horizon. It seems like it's endless...
Even I am not numb to the consequences of the seasons' advent... And this is more suitable for the current weather.
But this is merely the garb of a normal shrine maiden... it's what I wear almost every day.
I don't see where that jealousy comes from... That vest covered you pretty well, too.
O-oh, truly? Well, thank you for the compliment... and I look forward to see you revealed, as well.
So we are both slightly dissatisfied by the present company. Shall we console each other, then?
So you want to keep all the men for yourself, Meia? How greedy of you...
Hm... rather than being driven into worship, I would say that I was born into it. With my father being a monk, and me being raised in a shrine, I didn't have much of a choice to begin with.

{haiku}A single purpose:
days without end, spent writing;
practice makes perfect.
{!reset}I simply have dedicated most of my life to haiku. Were I to match music to my words, I would probably have a harder time.

Inspiration from war? True; negative experiences can be the basis of poetry... but I'd rather write about more peaceful topics:
{haiku} With tired, sweating hands
amidst the raging maelstrom
I wish I were home.
I'm hardly a "warrior poet", Aloy. I am more of a "poet dragged into war"...
Well, I don't usually pay much attention to Halloween, since it is a Nohrian custom... which also makes it an unexplored topic for haiku.
Oh, they most certainly do! Even seeing other people's costumes is a source of inspiration.
Hmm? What is a communion, exactly? I have offered food to the gods, but it's usually sake, not wafers...
No, not really. My haiku are just poems, not religious teachings. After all, proselytism would hardly be welcome in a strip poker game.

Human beings often find themselves befallen by catastrophes, or are simply left unsatisfied by their circumstances. If they could change their position, then obviously they would. It would be cruel to pretend otherwise.

I simply dedicate myself to what I find enjoyable: poetry. Is it truly so hard to comprehend?{haiku}
Another poor soul
trapped by productivity
my heart weeps for you.

{haiku}Do not confuse, Blake,
seclusion with loneliness;
I chose my few friends.
{!reset}As of late, I have managed to be at ease both by myself and with other people.

{haiku}A like-minded soul?
Trading both verses and clothes,
I shall play along.

There is more than poetry than just rhyming, Revy. But I suppose some people will never be able to appreciate such things...
{haiku}To poetry's flow,
some are as a newborn pup;
I pity such fools.
On the contrary, Jura, I find that mere observation of what is beautiful is not enough. By writing haiku, I can more effectively revere the elegance of the world.

Hm... Father does like challenging me, but, ultimately, he only wants me to do my best... regardless of how tiresome it is.
{haiku} Seeking excellence
for their offspring; is it not
a parent's nature?
Now that is an interesting question. Are you offering, perhaps, to take care of me yourself?
Well, being locked up isn't that bad... and, in any case, it wasn't to protect me from perverts... Besides, are you sure ~player~ is a pervert? ~player.ifMale(He|She)~ hasn't said anything yet...
Ah, I suppose my bra comes next... huh? What are you talking about, Blake?
While it is far too early to say for sure, I would not be opposed to such a thing. Who knows what will happen between us, hm?
Me, bored by poetry? That would be impossible, to put it plainly. And combined with the fact that I seldom have the chance to hear poems from others... I shall gladly hear you out, Miko.
Worry not, Reimu. Even if I did intend to take away your worshipers, I wouldn't follow you into your world to do so. Too much of a hassle, really.

It's all good. After all, we are here to enjoy ourselves, aren't we? And besides, it's hard to remain angry, looking at a cute face like yours.
{haiku}A sudden dark cloud
will not mar this sunny day;
it fades too quickly.
Well, I have simply followed the path that my attire mandated. But don't worry, Mari; you shall not be alone in undress for much longer.

Hmm... In that regard, it would seem that we stand as opposites. I started writing haiku for myself, as a way to palliate my loneliness; I suppose poetry is simply a more intimate art form than music.
Indeed, I am no ordinary shrine maiden. I am a poet, too; and as a poet, I cannot avert my eyes from the more vulgar aspects of humanity.
My type? I must admit, I have never given it much thought. Personally, I am more concerned with compatibility than appearances, in any case.
An oven? That is quite an outlandish method to conceive a new person, Caitlin...
Well, that is fine. After all, just your nude body will be inspiration enough...
I do not have much love for it, either. While I have met some good friends, I have had enough of the battlefield for a lifetime. But it is the course fate has set for me, and so I must walk it.

Well, I could never deny a request:
{haiku}Wielder of portents,
cutest of all alchemists;
a self-made woman.
{!reset}Is that enough praise for you?
Ugh, discipline. No, thank you. I already have Father for that.
Oh, it certainly is comfortable enough to sleep in at the very least. As for the "traditional" part, it's pretty much your average Hoshidan shrine maiden outfit...

{haiku}In youth, loneliness;
I sought succor in poems,
catharsis through words.
{!reset} It's not a particularly happy tale, but it made me who I am today.

I concur.
{haiku}Poets whose roads crossed,
a prolific dialogue
is sure to follow.
I grew up in a Shinto shrine. Worship the gods, heal the injured, practice my poetry. An uneventful, yet comfortable existence.
It isn't particularly complex, but some of the training can be pretty rough... Learning how to heal, in particular, was exhausting.
We refer to them as "gods" in Hoshido, and I wouldn't consider myself chosen by them. I am but a servant.
I take it that you have ample experience in the matter, then? I must confess that despite my interest, I am not so knowledgeable about carnal topics.

Sure, why not? It could serve as a prelude of what is to come...
{haiku}Both worn out, I watch
as your chest rises and falls;
my world became you.
Indeed I am. But you seem to be no slouch at haiku yourself, Senko!

A request? It's not my usual method, but I'll acquiesce:
{haiku} From another world
she prances, and gold cascades;
pride in every step.
Oh, my favorite subject is flowers! For them, I'd even be willing to venture outside.
I aspire to be more acclaimed for my poetry than for my body... but I hope you enjoy it, nonetheless.

{haiku} Amid nude beauty
I stand; broadened horizons
beyond my four walls.
This game has certainly been enjoyable... and I look forward to its climax, Jura.
I'm not sure our ideals of beauty are exactly analogous, Jura. But you are right about the fighting, so I'll concede you have a point.
Hmm... I have had similar experiences, actually. The only artist I have come across while in the army is Shigure, and he is a painter.
But I am writing poetry about the game, Meia. You are just distancing yourself from it.

Haah... If only it were that simple. Shortly after birth, I was sent away to a safer Deeprealm... but then it was invaded by enemies anyway. And now, the safer place for me is my parents' army... so I must fight.
True, I like gazing at the sky... but the view from a spaceship must be completely different to what us see from the ground. Frankly, I am jealous!

Well, that is true. Not everyone is as blessed with words as I am. But I think you are selling yourself short, Meia; it's better to be blunt than to be so convoluted that others cannot understand you.
If you are as stimulating in bed as you are poem-wise, I would be a fool not to accept your proposal, wouldn't I?
Oh, is that so? And what would this worship entail? Provided that it's not too tiresome, I'm inclined to try...

{haiku}At some point, whether
sooner or later, harvest
blesses all alike.
Oh, did a muse appear before you? I would be more than happy to listen...
Well, Father always had strange ideas about the gods, despite being a priest himself. Perhaps some of them found their way to me.
It is, actually. This whole experience has been strangely liberating, in fact.

An example, hm?
{haiku} Walking with Father
through a forest dyed by spring,
memories of green.
Oh, you won't have to rely on your imagination for much longer, Senko...
Oh, I write haiku and the occasional tanka. A poet must be fully devoted to their craft, you see.
A connection? Hmm... Not a direct one. The gods tend to be subtle in their favor... at least in my experience.
Poetry is my passion; haiku, in particular. Having composed so many of them, my words spontaneously conform to the meter.
Well, the short answer is that, when I was young, I mistook my mother's songs for poetry. I wished to learned how to write words like that, and was thus given haiku books.
For me, haiku are as natural as breathing. But I do have to write the poems down, or else I forget them...
Oh, this? It comes with the shrine maiden outfit, and it's actually not that heavy. I suppose I just have become accustomed to wearing it.

Well, it's a chance to expand my list of topics...
{haiku}Clad in blue only,
a goddess humbled by luck,
taking off her clothes.
The limit depends mostly on the skill of the caster and the type of staff that is used. Supposedly, there is even a staff that can resurrect the dead...
They also enjoy not bleeding to death. My role is to heal injuries with my magic, you see.
Well, that is true. I must admit I don't have much experience with intimacy. And your point is?
Yes, on occasion. It's not too orthodox, though, to lose sight of your surroundings by focusing on yourself...

Oh, of course I will.
{haiku}Mercenary fiend,
why did we have to cross paths?
You're not what I dreamed...
{!reset} See, I even made it rhyme, just for you.
I am also fond of taking naps. Peace and quiet are something you can never enough of... but I'm not sure if you would be inclined to agree.
While I cannot say my life at the shrine was always to my liking, I was never actively mistreated.

My, how surprising! Even someone like you shows hints of what could be mistaken as something insightful. Keep polishing your craft, and perhaps in a decade or so you will reach the level of an average child.
I'm afraid not. It would have been ages ago... I do remember the first haiku I even wrote, though.
Anywhere and everywhere, really. When the moment is right, I simply must seize it, you see.
Well, yes. There's this friend who recently lent me a literal cartload of romance novels. It's good to broaden your horizons, even if the quality of the books is not the highest.
Hmm... While it may have been unusual, my youth was largely unremarkable. Aside from poetry, I spent my time with the usual duties of a shrine maiden: worshiping the gods, cleaning, basic healing...
Actually, leaving or entering a Deeprealm is pretty easy. You just have to go through the Dragon's Gate, the same way I arrived here.
Hmm... I see fate as something fixed and unchangeable, yes. Destiny is what causes our actions, not the other way around. Why did you ask?

Not much, I'm afraid. And what little experience I have is exclusive to the fairer sex...
{haiku}Two kindred spirits,
intimate exploration
by the candle's light.
Don't worry, I won't unduly prolong my stay in this game. Whether I win or lose is of no particular concern to me.
Not problems, per se, but I did tie it a bit looser than I currently do.
Frankly, all this heat really accomplishes is melting my thoughts together. But you do have a point about the daring outfits...

Ah, I'm not sure if I am exactly a model of self-improvement, but...
{haiku}Only those who climb
can see their previous selves;
the view from the top.
Yeah, yeah, I'm more awake now... Ah, why is everyone so keen on interrupting my slumber?
Truly? But healing was one of the things I learned early in my training... I suppose Hoshidan shrine maidens have their own priorities.
Well, we are already allied with Nohr... But the more the merrier, really. I'm sure Mother would be happy to discuss terms.

Seiros? No, that name doesn't sound familiar... Besides, Shinto is a polytheistic religion.
{haiku} Infinite watchers
like the stars far above us;
the myriad gods.
Is that so? Then it is certainly fortuitous for us to meet here. I shall gladly enlighten you in regards to poetry, Lysithea.
Indeed, To be more precise, this is the outfit of a Hoshidan shrine maiden.
I resent that remark, Jura! Were I completely uninterested in changing my perspective, I wouldn't be here to begin with.
Well, it is simple: poetry is what I live for. Shouldn't a person live for their own sake, rather than for the sake of others?
What I desire? Hmm...obviously, a kind person, that can respect my personal space, and doesn't cause trouble for me. Ideally, someone that can match me in poetry.

{haiku}Regal, striking thrones
lack the warmth I truly need;
I prefer my bed.
Bullheadedness is hardly a virtue, oh mighty queen.
Me, petrified by beauty? Doubtful. Father's voice, threatening to tear me away from my blessed slumber... now that's a horrifying prospect.
Riveting. Keep practicing, and you might compose something of note eventually.
If you truly want a chance, you'd do well in keeping me far away from any form of combat, thank you very much.
Oh? Now that is something interesting, for once... If you are interested in poetry beyond it being a mean to infatuate more princesses, I wouldn't be opposed to assist you.
And yet, such an image shall remain in the realm of imagination for the time being.

Haah... While I do wish for such things, their price would be prohibitively steep.
{haiku}Endless luxuries
pale when compared to freedom;
the peak ideal.
While I am not completely opposed to such flirtations, I hope you don't expect them to sway my heart in any way, Bowsette.
Oh, I'm not overly fond of children. They tend to be too noisy, and often disturb the quiet with their boundless enthusiasm...
Assuming your personality stays unchanging, I'm afraid none of your appearances will find much success.
Ah... I hope you will allow me a moment. These sunglasses make being outside much more tolerable...
Ah... they may fit with the beach theme, but these sunglasses don't make much sense indoors...
Recently, the base has become such a mess... They are fighting amongst themselves for a ticket for a summer vacation, of all things!
Oh, I am, in fact, wearing a swimsuit. It is just underneath this t-shirt.
My turn again? Finally, my swimsuit will see the light of day.
This swimsuit is far more revealing than I would otherwise wear...
A shrine maiden wouldn't usually celebrate a Nohrian harvest festival, but if there is candy on the line...
Oh, this witch outfit? It is only to celebrate the harvest. I haven't made any sudden career changes...
I may not be an expert in offensive magic, but I have had assistance from a certain someone...
But even in a foreign costume, my heart beats at the rhythm of haiku. That will never change.
Must I truly part with my hat? It's the last part of my witch ensemble...
Ah, my penultimate loss. Thus, my witch outfit shall become a mere memory.
W-wait... I have to t-take off m-my c-clothes? B-but the p-purity of a s-shrine m-maiden i-i-is s-sacred! Kyaaah! I c-can't do t-this!
Oh, it's my turn? After all this time, I was starting to feel sleepy...

Finally, my turn arrives.
{haiku}I'd almost been turned
from active participant
to mere observer.

{haiku}Reduced to a toy
in destiny's cruel jaws
an endless torment...
When failure is an inevitability, you eventually become numb to it.
I can't be too angry at this sequence of events... if anything, such a miraculous event baffles me.
Oh, I lost again. It almost feels like a foregone conclusion at this point...
Frankly, it's almost insulting to lose in this manner... Were it not for the promise that all but one of you will eventually be in the same predicament, I would have left already.

{haiku}Entangled by fate
I will never break the chain;
the strings that pull me.
I thought I understood the rules of this game. Clearly, I was wrong.
I don't even need to look at the cards anymore... I lost, didn't I?
Seems fate really wanted me to take off my clothes today...
I don't relish being the center of attention in this manner.
With so many consecutive losses, I won't be able to write anything!
Now I know how Setsuna feels after falling into a pitfall yet again...
But what if I simply discarded that adjective and... Wait, me again?
So much for beginner's luck...
Perhaps there is a rule I am not aware of yet...
Oh, two losses in a row. Well, that's the cost of inexperience, I am afraid.
It's not a very good sign for a poet to repeat herself...
Hmm, a sudden bout of misfortune... Well, as long as it limits itself to cards, then it should be fine.
Ah, I couldn't expect too much of my poor, lone card.
My! I didn't think this would be a losing hand... I should readjust my expectations.

{haiku}Once again, a choice:
my armor, stalwart bulwark
is the answer now.

{haiku}Yet another loss;
this shrine maiden will soon be
just a nude maiden.
My turn again? Perhaps if I had inherited some of my mother's strategical prowess, I wouldn't find myself in this position. Then again, it probably doesn't translate well to cards...
Hmm... next is my bra. Were you waiting for this, perhaps?
Me? Hmm... what should I reveal first?
I have no more last-minute surprises... This time, I shall truly show myself...
My turn? I'll give you three guesses as to what I will take off. The first two don't count.
Ah, I lost. I suppose I could take off my hair ties, but at this point, that would just be needlessly cruel.
It might be a bit strange to wear a shrine maiden outfit to a place like this, but I have grown so accustomed to wearing it, it feels strange not to. Which part of it should I take off first...?
These lines are considered in addition to the (winning, normal, losing) must strip states.
These lines are considered in addition to the (winning, normal, losing) must strip states.
These lines are considered in addition to the (winning, normal, losing) must strip states.

I might be a bit overdressed... What should I start with?
It's only fair that I show mine, don't you think?
They say this when they're winning - they have more clothing items left than other players.
They say this when they're winning - they have more clothing items left than other players.
They say this when they're winning - they have more clothing items left than other players.
They say this when they're winning - they have more clothing items left than other players.
Well, I can't get left behind...
Red and white are the traditional colors of the Hoshidan shrine maiden... The actual outfit may differ from one shrine to another, but you can identify us just by our appearance.
What the character says when they're in the middle of the group in terms of clothes left.
What the character says when they're in the middle of the group in terms of clothes left.
What the character says when they're in the middle of the group in terms of clothes left.
