What the character says when they're in the middle of the group in terms of clothes left.
Right from the start, I am already behind? Hmmm...
This is not entirely unexpected. Beyond haiku, naps and perhaps healing, I have little else to boast about.

{haiku} A new enterprise:
inexperience, punished;
only clothes to pay.
I must depart with my dress this early? My, this truly is far from my area of expertise.
The character has lost a round, and also has the fewest pieces of clothing left.
The character has lost a round, and also has the fewest pieces of clothing left.
The character has lost a round, and also has the fewest pieces of clothing left.
Exactly, Meia. Experiences like these make the nuisances of travel worth it.
Hmph. Had I brought my bow, I would be more than happy to prove you wrong, you know?
No, thank you. I'd much rather be myself than you.

Well, if nothing else, you are quick. However...
{haiku} Though soaring, your words
are as vacuous as air
and carry no weight. {!reset}
There is still plenty of time left.

Ah. Just an unprompted verbal assault, then.
{haiku}Unruly, rude child.
Did your father not teach you
not to taunt people?
Well, I shall rest a bit easier knowing you do not hold a grudge against me, personally. I might have asked what your "thing" was, but I'd rather not rub salt into the wound.

I see, I see...
{haiku}Poor Nagatoro,
turned into a deviant
by ~player.ifMale(his|her)~ heinous schemes...

{haiku}Such brazen praises!
You certainly waste no time
in airing your thoughts...

I can certainly commiserate with that. The key, I would say, is finding the right people to be with:
{haiku}With like-minded friends
without the isolation
you could get your peace.

Am I truly so undesirable, Nagatoro?
{haiku}Ruptured and sundered
by such a brusque refusal,
my heart gently weeps. {!reset}
Perhaps I should focus my attention towards others... ~player~, maybe?
Reimu, my poetry is the means through which I express my soul, not some bait for foolish visitors... Must you reduce everything to worshipers and donations?

{haiku}A warning, ignored;
unaware of my clothing,
how truly foolish...
Oh yes, by all means! But I shall warn you: I am a fairly strict critic...

Oh, of course!
{haiku}Like an endless spring,
my poems constantly flow;
fierce torrent of words.
{!reset} Though if you have a specific prompt...

For haiku, of course!
{haiku}A glimpse of the world
in a few words; poetry
in its purest form.
My, such a generous proposal! Do you extend it to every maiden you come across?
Hmm... to be more precise, I would like someone who doesn't annoy me, and whose company is pleasant for me. Although that doesn't narrow it down that much...
Well, yes, eventually. For now, everyone is still a bit too covered for that...

Most people are baffled by my habits, Meia. You are but another name in a long list.
{haiku}I seek only peace;
why do the others refuse
to live and let live?
Hmmm... well, power to them. I just don't see the point of swimming against the currents of fate.
Oh, but you don't need to worry. Recently, I find myself alongside more people that I know how to deal with; if anything, I crave the quiet now.
Given that I belong to an army, I am pretty much in constant demand... but I'd rather gain renown for my literary skills, instead.
Oh, it is fine to take this off; we are very far from the battlefield. And, well, I have to remove it before I move on to my other garments...

My, you certainly have a one-track mind, haven't you? And, well, I don't know that much about burial rites... dead bodies are viewed as impure, so the rituals concerning them don't take place at a shrine.
Danmaku battles? Is that how you wage wars in this Gensokyo of yours?
Hmmm... Father belongs to the army, and Mother is pretty much its leader... Yes, I suppose our situations are not too dissimilar.

True, I am still improving. And as long as I find joy in poetry, that's what really matters.
{haiku}Traipsing through the snow
I slowly ascend towards
a peak I can't see.
Actually, I have never been in such close contact with any deity before. You are the first one, Senko.
Then perhaps you would be willing to assist me when it's my turn to forfeit? Even if just with words, such aid would certainly be welcome.
To put it plainly, I don't think there can be any beauty in fighting. It should be avoided, not celebrated. Its only charm is its ending.
A world without flowers? That seems unthinkable... and rather sad, to be honest.
Hmm... I wouldn't say men lack beauty, Jura. They just have a different type of it. Less akin to a prairie, more similar to a rocky, imposing mountain.
Yes... I may direct my gaze towards the stars a bit more often after today. But for now, I hope you'll be looking at me instead.
Is that so, Jura? Then I shall reveal the next verse...
Well, I can't blame you too much for not paying close attention. I'm just removing my armor, after all.
Oh? That is not an unwelcome proposal. Do you have a plan in mind, then?
Men, huh? Well, compared to Father, I would say they are amenable, in the end. If you are worried about being too different, you should simply look for a man similar to you.
At times, my verses soar out of reach of the most fatuous of my comrades... It is somewhat disappointing, yet inevitable, in the end.

A haiku for Meia? Oh, sure:
{haiku} Quiet, piercing eyes
that consider every move;
exposed, yet reserved.

Another one? Well, I can't back down from a poetic challenge, can I?
{haiku}A lustrous, harsh sun;
impossible to ignore,
shining above all.
Oh, very interesting... It isn't often that I meet someone that can match me in poetry.
Huh... by how attached you are to your job, I had assumed you had been pretty much born into it. But in my case, I don't think I'll ever come to enjoy all this fighting.

Oh, the constellations should be similar in your home planet, compared to those of Earth!
{haiku}From a distant world
I see the old Pleiades
shining all the same.

Oh?
{haiku}Flame claims the young woods:
screams against the raging blaze,
prayers that it stops.
Nobody is born a poet, Mari. I would be more to happy to aid you in this subject, if you wish to learn.
Oh, is that true? And how do you intend to do so, Mari?

I wouldn't be opposed to a kiss, either...
{haiku} No matter which form
your affection takes, I can't
spurn such pure feelings.
Yes, it's a good thing we were able to mend our relationship. I must admit, I was guilty too... I can be a bit abrasive, sometimes.
Indeed, it's hard to keep grudges in a game like this. After all, our deeper selves are revealed in the process...
And also given the right company.
Yes, dreams may be just dreams, but that doesn't mean they can't come true, right?
Oh, you have nothing to worry about. Personality-wise, we match pretty well, don't you think?
Hm, now I'm the one who feels tempted. A massage given by you must be heavenly...
Not much of a haiku fan? Well, they are not for everyone.
Oh, a shrine maiden is someone who works at a shrine, assisting in rituals for the gods. That's the basic explanation, at least...
Oh, I believe I can see now exactly what your offer is. You want me to join this sex cult of yours, don't you? If so, I must decline, as am currently busy.
Anyone can cobble some rhyming words, alongside a hackneyed melody. To elicit emotions, to make an image come true with mere words... that goes far beyond than any of your "songs" do.
Oh, but it is amusing to see a godly being losing a game of cards, of all things.
Unlucky and a sore loser? My, what an interesting combination...
Oh, I merely intended to evoke a striking image. And a goddess brought down to a mortal level in a strip poker game must surely be one... wouldn't you agree, Aqua?
Ah... In a perfect world, there would be no dangers which would warrant wearing such armor. But mine isn't like that, I'm afraid.
Indeed I am. Though I wasn't able to see them often when I was young, recently we have had an opportunity to reconnect.
Why, thank you. But I'd say it's actually the other way around: I need to cultivate a sophisticated language in order to compose adequate poetry.
...As much as I would like to trade my relatively comfortable position for constant danger in a wretched hive of scum and villainy, I must decline your offer.
Oh, please. Unlike you, I don't need to sully my vocabulary to convey my intentions.
Hobbies are done for your own enjoyment, not for the sake of others. If I want to spend my time napping, that's what I do.
Oh, not like that. It's not orthodox in the sense that the poet is supposed to be one with nature. Though I haven't always lived up to those standards myself...
Haah... While I would like to dismiss your words, I cannot fully do so... But you are right; there are more pressing matters to attend to.
I'm not that well-furnished, but I manage. I do prefer Hoshidan festal to Nohrian rods; the extra range makes up for their relatively lower power...
For the time being, I'm content to merely observe. After all, a real vision is not something that can be replaced...
My, how ominous... What, do you throw them overboard?
Shinto rites are as diverse as the gods they are meant to revere, Lysithea. At the shrine in which I grew up, we mostly offered food, for example.
Hmm... Yes, that is a common misconception amongst the uninitiated. Yet it is not enough for poetry to have a suitable subject, lest it fall to the level of prose; its form must be equally polished.
Oh, but it is a trivial matter. My attire is not something I am overly concerned with.
What an eclectic education... From the looks of it, you had a exhausting childhood!

Farewell, my sunglasses.
{haiku}Shield against the rays
of the fierce, merciless sun;
your guard is over.
Off they go. Now all that I have left is the swimsuit itself...

Indeed, Nadeshiko.
{haiku}A looming shadow,
the prospect of yet more work;
my free time, tainted.
Luckily, I can take as long as I want here.
Even Father got involved, somehow. But luckily, I managed to abscond here, a much more peaceful place...
I could have shown it from the start, but I wanted to preserve the mystery, the allure of the unknown... After all, it is part of the appeal of this game, don't you think?
I never learned how to swim. The Deeprealm I grew up was landlocked, so all we had were shallow rivers...
But all the swimsuits they had available covered as much as this one does. One was made out of leaves, while other had a cape and the bare minimum...
Still, it is far more elaborate than my usual clothing... At least I didn't have to put it on.
Besides, Mother will be happy. She always talks about fostering ties between Hoshido and Nohr, so even unorthodox acts like this are proof of her success.
Thanks to her guidance, I can use actual spells, even if just basic ones.
Ah, well. While it is beautiful, it is also a weight to which I'm not accustomed.
Unwrapping these can be annoying, but I have plenty of experience.
And to think I was the only one with some shred of cover left... well, not anymore.
And so, the best was left for last...
I may have been slightly overdressed... let's correct that, shall we?
Strange for a haiku poet to be an innovator...
As you can see, I'm not a very good poker player... but I compensate for it in other ways.

{haiku}Nude by fate's decrees,
I strip not defeated, but
a leader, instead.
I came here out of curiosity, not pursuing victory. Having to go first will not deter me in the slightest.
Finding myself in this position is hardly surprising. I scarcely have time to waste on card games, after all.

{haiku}Loss followed by loss,
the prize of naivete;
I shall gladly pay.
Well, someone has to be the first one. If that role falls onto me, I won't reject it.
I didn't have time to plan a strategy... nor would I have done so, frankly. I'd rather spend my time in other ways.
We all know what this game is leading towards. The order of events is pretty much meaningless, don't you think?
Finally, it's time to reveal what I had kept hidden all along... Did you expect this kind of underwear from a shrine maiden?
Removing our clothes can be understood as a celebration of the human condition. We are not so different, after all...
Removing our clothes can be understood as a celebration of what unites us. We are not so different, after all, in the aspects that truly matter.
It is strange to think that I have managed to stay covered this long... Who knows, I may end up winning this little game of ours...
To freely show our forbidden aspects to the room... Finally, it is my chance to do so.

{haiku}To live far above,

{haiku}Meaningless bauble

{haiku}Disrobing, a once

By the way, which god do you worship at the Hakurei Shrine, Reimu? Amaterasu, Ebisu? Probably not Inari...

Ah, the lifestyle of a farmer! So idyllic and peaceful, I'm envious...
{haiku}Free from urbane woes,
an honest and tranquil life
alongside nature.
Nadeshiko, do you have any pursuits, aside from camping? Surely you can't be fortunate enough to live a life of pure leisure...
What moves you to camp, Nadeshiko? A desire for adventure, a natural inclination for the outdoors...?
So your whole demeanor was a fabrication... honestly, I don't understand it. Why would you go through all that trouble?
In your group, you rely on your friends to protect you, don't you? Father is always pestering me to practice with the bow, but it's so time-consuming...
So your powers go far beyond healing, Mia? My, you almost make me feel jealous...
And you said you have traveled all over the world? That does sound interesting... aside from all the walking, and the rough sleep, and all the little inconveniences of travel, of course.
And you are the only healer on your group? What a big responsibility...
And you say you are a fan of horror books, Yuri? What exactly is it that draws you towards them? Personally, I feel like I already have enough troubles in my life as it is...
Are you here to seek lewd experiences as inspiration for your writing, Yuri? After all, a writer's works are shaped by their experiences...
So you had a life of luxury, with all manner of pleasures at hand's reach and no toils to suffer through. Why would you ever want to abandon such a blissful existence?
Being popular has its benefits, but it would also mean there's a lot of pressure to create something that people like... I don't think I could write my poems for the sake of others, honestly.
And even after your injury, you still keep fighting? My, I don't know whether to consider you dedicated or desperate.
My, you two sure are clingy... Do you ever manage to disentangle from each other, or have you fully merged into a single entity?
You aren't the kind of person who thrives in this kind of social environment, are you Meia? Neither am I, and yet here we stand...
The way you talk about men resembles the way some people from Hoshido talk about Nohrians. Strange, the gulfs people create...
That sword, that mien... Are you sure you are not a transmigrated Hoshidan?
Damage from cursed swords is probably beyond my capabilities as a healer. Still, it wouldn't hurt to take a closer look...
Well-spoken, wise... Whence does such wisdom originate, Dunban?
Did you come here seeking some real-world experience, Wikipe-tan? If so, we are in the same boat; there is only so much books can tell...
Tell me, Mia: are your parents healers, too? From my experience, that tends to be the case...
I don't have many chances to discuss poetry with a fellow writer, Yuri... Surely you will agree with me that haiku is the supreme form of poetry, won't you?
Oh, a songstress? Can't say I'd ever envision myself on your shoes, Miku. I'm not the type to declaim my poetry to the four winds, really.
And so, you say you are an idol... how many people would you say attend your concerts, Miku?
Do you have trouble with keeping appearances as an idol? Binding yourself to the expectations of your fans appears horribly tiresome to me.
You really seem exceedingly well-read, Wikipe-tan... But how much do you know about haiku, in particular?

{haiku}A distant figure;
is it a fellow walker
of this lonesome path?
{!reset} Incidentally, how long have you been writing, Yuri?
If you are blind, does that mean you can't read anything? What a pitiful existence...
Your passion and single-minded focus... I can certainly respect that. One must fully devote oneself to a subject in order to master it.
And you were chosen by your own school, Kyoko? Is that how such institutions usually function?
There are also Ultimates with artistic pursuits, aren't there? What exactly are the criteria for choosing them?
I must say, it truly is a shame that you have chosen to forgo more transient pleasures in lieu of lifelong commitment, Reimu. Why not enjoy the little detours life has to offer?
Ah... an almost perfect facsimile of my own mother. Still, your blonde hair is a much welcome distinction.
This situation is far too strange to completely process... I keep thinking this is a dream I'll eventually wake up from.
So you will succeed to the throne of your country in the future... Aren't you afraid that will conflict with your own wishes?
It's a small wonder you are so confident... This is your element, after all.
We do want to see you naked, ~name~... are you going to refuse our request?

My, meeting face to face with a deity is certainly unexpected... particularly in a place like this.
{haiku}Blessing the profane,
undeniable presence:
a goddess's descent.
Even though I am a poet, my vocabulary is far from infinite... Perhaps you could enlighten me in regards to the meaning of those words in the whiteboard, ~name~.
A familiar environment, turned into a den of sin... I wonder if you will ever see a classroom the same after this, ~name~.
Are you here to overcome your shyness, ~name~? I can assure you, there is nothing to be afraid of.
You can't be so embarrassed if you came here out of your own volition, ~name~...
Don't worry too much, ~name~- you are just starting.
Sometimes the first step is the hardest to take, isn't it?

{haiku}Locked all day inside
writing for eternity
doesn't sound so bad...
{!reset}Alas, if only I didn't have an endless stream of duties to attend to...
Afraid of ending up in my situation, ~name~? I assure you, by the time you are, you'll yearn for it.
A bit shy, aren't we? Well, it was my turn already; now it's yours.
A hero, huh... Going out of the way to fix people's problems is not really my cup of tea. Usually the problems find me first - in the shape of yet more people in need of healing.

When I was little, I tried to repeat my mother's lullabies, but I never had a singing voice like yours...
{haiku}Instead of poems,
to voice my feelings in song...
alas, I lacked skill.

{haiku}Finding an artist
in such a place... Do you seek
inspiration, too?
My, you are really relishing your loss! Yet I suppose it's only natural people like you would gravitate towards a game like this one...
It is no wonder that a game where you have to take off your clothes would attract people who relish the chance to do so...

I'm afraid there's little room for intelligence in a game like this...
{haiku}Winning or losing,
no matter how well you plan,
comes down to pure chance.

Your turn, ~name~...
An unchanged visage:
proof of stoic willpower
or simple boredom?
Huh... I'm more used to gods as entities to be worshiped, not as physical presences than you can see and touch... this will be interesting.

{haiku}Not much for talking?
Actions are louder than words,
so show what you got.
This game really isn't that complicated. If anything, you are probably overthinking it, ~name~...
It is unusual to see someone who appreciates the value of silence even more that I do, ~name~...
A school uniform is not a common sight in a game like this... but then again, neither is a shrine maiden outfit.
The world of fashion is an enigma to me; its whims, incomprehensible. So are the minds of those who follow them...
I don't see the point in amassing such a large collection of clothes. My shrine maiden outfit suits all occasions.
Two followers of the gods in this den of sin? My, what are the chances...
Oh, it's ~name~'s turn... again. You shouldn't try to hog all the attention, it is unbecoming.
You do know that most of us will be naked at the end of the game, don't you? I assure you, there's no need to rush frantically.
Your body may be alluring, but your pacing leaves something to be desired.
I suppose I'll have to thank you for shielding us from yet another loss, hero. Although maybe you should start to look out for yourself...

{haiku}Is this purple room
not auspicious towards you?
Regardless, you lost.
Though you may be prepared, you will fall nonetheless... such is the essence of this game.
Not a fan of the scorching sun and the sizzling sands, are you, ~name~? It's fine, really... neither am I.
One of my friends has a similar demeanor to yours, and would feel at home here. You enjoy this atmosphere too, don't you, ~name~?
Even in front of such a large audience, you'll stay nonetheless? You are braver than you seem, ~name~.
Celebrating the game here was probably your idea, was it not, ~name~? Some of us are not so keen on exposing ourselves for nothing, you know...
Well, at least one of us enjoys these daunting circumstances.
Oh, ~name~, I would very much like to see more of you... and more than just seeing, too.
And thus, the winner is decided. But don't applaud yet, because this play is far from over...
Well, go on... you can't enter the water with your clothes still burdening you, after all.
Ugh... fine, if you really think puns would help lighten the atmosphere... wait, that one was unintentional!
Oh, no... the only thing worse than a pun is a forced one. It's alright, really, there is no need to continue!

{haiku}Your rough demeanor
fits better the battlefield
than a friendly game.

{haiku}Though you tried to flee,
your reckoning approaches
as it does for all.

{haiku}The strong falls at last,
like a dream in a spring night
dust before the wind.
I suspect you may be under some sort of curse. Now that you know, you should remove it posthaste... after the game ends, of course.

{haiku}Are you actually
unlucky, or just really
desperate to strip?
{!reset}Either way, I shall not complain.

{haiku}Rejoice at your streak:
for to succeed at failure
is no modest feat.

{haiku}You again? This game
can certainly be cruel!
More power to me.
I wouldn't get too worked up about this game; after all, we don't know each other, and we will probably never meet again.
Yes, this is part of the game too. Much more interesting that the card-playing part, if you ask me.
Well, let me get comfortable and- wait, I'm not the loser? Huh, I almost wanted to start...
Oh, I almost thought it would be my turn to...
I did mention that I attract miracles, didn't I?
In a fair world, I would be the one who lost, instead of ~name~. Still, if it's just cards...

{haiku}It would seem you lost:
All is fair in love and war
the proverb says so.

{haiku}Humbled by fortune
did you learn your lesson yet?
Shed your rage and play.

{haiku}Anger without check;
like a sword without a hilt,
will cut you as well.
Try as you might, your tantrums cannot avert the hands of fate, ~name~.

{haiku} With unmarred beauty,
a diamond amidst garbage
will shine brighter still!
I don't usually find myself among such high-class company. Strange to do so in a place like this...
Ah, another chance for you to grace us with your nudity. I think your wish to strip may be even bigger than my desire to see you in the nude...

It is certainly inspiring to see someone with such a bold approach to this game!
{haiku}For others, a loss;
for you, a chance to dazzle:
shine on, brilliant star.
It is always encouraging to work with such an eager model! You'll make sure to show everything, won't you, ~name~?

{haiku}Trust the whims of fate
and you will end up betrayed:
a lesson well learned.
You thought you were safe, didn't you? Yet you always were in the hands of fate...
Ah, the game is over for you, ~name~... But perhaps you'll find better luck with those machines at the back.

{haiku}Struggle all you want
everything pales to the might
of a Royal Flush.

{haiku}No room for concern
my victory was assured;
majesty trumps all.

{haiku}Overwhelming might
my opponents fall like flies
but only this round...

{haiku}To escape a bear;
to avoid loss, all you need
is not coming last.

{haiku}Reminder to self:
always keep your highest card
it might come in hand.

{haiku}Five cards in order;
all other struggles, futile:
my promised triumph.

{haiku}All suits assembled:
All shall bow before my might!
...temporarily

{haiku}In this knowledge den,
you are our newest subject;
time to watch and learn.

{haiku}Fate decreed your loss
yet there's room for you to choose:
what will you discard?

{haiku}All of us must lose;
what you do afterward, though,
depends on your choice.

{haiku}Fret not: after this,
you will simply be reborn
as another you.
Victory and defeat are decided by mere luck, rather than complex and inscrutable machines... yes, it's better this way.

{haiku}Not by sharp weapons,
but by sharp luck, you are cut;
a far kinder loss.
Have at thee, scoundrel! Ah, I'm getting carried away by the stage...
Is the room working its magic on you, ~name~? Falling for someone, perchance?
Hmm... Perhaps holding this game outside wasn't the best idea...
Well, it certainly looks fun. It's almost a shame that it will be gone, bit by bit... By the way, how would you call such an outfit?
Ah, nightmares... Hm... I think I may have a solution; this magic charm, placed under your pillow, should aid you in your sleep. I use it myself, and it works very well.
Ah, I can certainly see what you mean by distancing yourself. To an extent, by writing haiku, I am doing the same, by treating this game as artistic inspiration...
Oh, I know what you mean! It's always good to broaden your literary horizons... Recently, after a friend's recommendation, I have taken a liking to reading romance novels, of all things.

Ah, philosophy... {haiku}
To seek a meaning
when there is none-what folly!
Man is truly strange.

When you look at me with those eyes, I cannot resist...
{haiku} Like an entranced moth
who freely goes to the flame,
I fear not burning...

Oh, I'd gladly accept! I have a feeling I have much to learn from someone as experienced as you...
{haiku}O dazzling star:
If I followed your light, what
wonders would I find?
I'm not sure I completely share that sentiment: the earlier rounds will probably not be very exciting. You yourself are an example of that, don't you think?
Ah, so you are a medicine maker, like Midori! You must be smarter than I had given you credit for, then...

Then we truly are kindred spirits!
{haiku}Torn from sweet slumber,
we must suffer through combat;
a most loathsome task!

My! Is that true?
{haiku}From just one answer
three questions rise in its place;
a black-clad riddle...

{haiku}From such deep slumber
a Blade awakens anew;
and yet, realized...
{!reset} How truly- My, that is bright!
Oh, do you think there's a fetish for shrine maidens, Reimu? Hmm... I think I can see why. After all, we are supposed to be pure and sacred.
Oh, and is healing included in those duties? In Hoshido, every shrine maiden is at least an initiate in the healing arts.

Ah, so that's where the insistence on marriage comes from...
{haiku}From this hoary tree
still one branch remains alive,
awaiting the spring.
But my room is where I create most of my poems! If I don't keep it in order, their quality suffers... And I simply am not good at cleaning.
Well, that's good to hear. Knowing that my endeavors are appreciated makes all the chores a little less bothersome.
My! She might be even faster than her pegasus!
I am certain your victims appreciate being assaulted by clean criminals, Jura.
Oh, sorry! It's just that I have encountered kitsune before, but never a kitsune deity...
So in the end, you become a victim to your own devoted nature. How pitiable...
I see, I see... Hey, you forgot the seasonal word!
Really? How so? To me, exercise is just pointless repetition... If anything, it dulls my mind. What I seek is new stimuli, not something I've already done countless times.
Is that so? How long have you known ~player.ifMale(him|her)~ for, anyway? You two must be intimate, to come together to a place like this...
Are you in such a rush that you cannot properly enjoy the views? Perhaps you should slow down, then...

Castles do have an imposing aura around them, don't they?
{haiku}Lone, still guardian
separating its allies
from its enemies.
Who is this Cinderella, to have made such a profound impression on you in so little time?
T-thousands?! That's more books than I've ever seen in my entire life... You must attend a very affluent school, then.
Interesting... Do any disagreements stem from a conflict in poetic opinions?

Hm. For me, keeping the exact same structure allows me to focus on the other aspects of the poem. {haiku}
Through this well-known path
I walk once more; no detail
shall elude my sight.
So in your experience, which is harder to write: prose or poetry? I have never ventured beyond the realm of haiku, but you should have a wider perspective.
I didn't do much hard work while I lived at the shrine, and my hobbies aren't exactly conductive to burning calories... Now that I actually have to exercise, though...
They must be truly delicious for you to bring them to a game like this.
Even so, is your weight really that much of a problem?
Hmm... I can see the aesthetic appeal of a weapon, even if I am not fond of conflict itself. Besides, it does suit you, Jura.
Is that so? Well, now I have to listen about it. Yes, something I've never seen...
Oh, that does answer my question- Wait, goddess of all water? That's...
Oh? And what do study at this "college" of yours? Do you chase a passion of yours, or do you merely seek to build a career?

Hmm... I can sympathize with the sentiment, but I'd rather turn inwards instead.
{haiku}Retreating, I seek
shelter from the raging storm;
silence, my reward.
Well, obviously you worship the god of the Hakurei shrine at the Hakurei shrine. I was merely curious about the identity of said god.
Oh, is that so? How fortunate, to have all that time freed up... You are making making me jealous, Aqua!
Truly? But he seems so... ordinary. How exactly did he free you from your chains, if I may ask?
And so, as the goddess of water, you receive a disproportionate amount of prayers, which fuel in turn your own godly powers... Truly, a devious system.
Have you thought about finding a more peaceful solution? Violence shouldn't be the first and only response...
Hah, that is the answer I had feared... Just once, I wish someone would say: "Actually, the key to gaining wisdom is napping". It would make everything much simpler.
Yes, I suppose you are right. In this place, the coexistence of similar, yet separate worlds is a real possibility. Still, your mixture of familiarity and novelty is certainly striking.
How so? There is a vast gulf between the two. If you may forgive my bluntness, only a truly desperate person would be forced to cling so tightly to a role they are no longer fit for.

I can assure you, it would be no trouble at all, Dunban.
{haiku} Away from the world,
you become all I behold;
together, alone.
Oh, staves always run out at the worst possible moment, don't they? At least we weren't in the middle of a battle...

{haiku}What is its purpose?
A marble throne for a king?
It shines like a gem...
A- a projectile weapon?! Why did you do that?
Well, if you do end up getting hurt, hopefully you will learn how bad of an idea this is... assuming you survive.
You may be aiming for your clothes, but you are blowing up my own ears with all the noise...

{haiku}A threat to our lives,
an assault on our eardrums;
what is not to like?
Wha... T-that's- I mean-T-those are real penises?
Ah! Are you okay, ~name~? W-where did I put my festal... Wait, I didn't bring it!

{haiku}Oh, how dramatic!
Engulfed in green flames, the cat
reveals his true self.
My, I am certainly surprised! Both that you are removing your bow this late, and that you were concealing cat ears under it... In my world, neither kitsune nor wolfskin typically hide theirs.
And besides, would Rhajat even come to a place like this? Maybe I should ask her...

{haiku}A dark wind arrives,
only to cast clothes aside;
magic made mundane. {!reset} That was an impressive display of skill!

My! That will most certainly solve all the issues...
{haiku} With blinding luster
a great metamorphosis
from insect, to god.
... but I didn't expect you to be this timid. Frankly, that is even more more surprising than your gender.
Oh, I have to wait a bit longer? Well, any mystery worth solving is also worth the wait...
Or you could go directly for your underwear. That's the logical option for an exhibitionist like Bobobo, I suppose...
Giving up so soon? You'll never know until you try.
Oh. Indeed, if your clothes don't even fit you anymore, that would be a strong incentive...
Oh, is that how "fries" is spelled? Let's see... "Po-te-katsu", hmm...
If you truly were Mother, I simply wouldn't be able to see this game through.
But ruling a whole country sounds so stressful... Could someone truly look forward to such a monumental task?
Huh. Now I'm curious... what do you do for a living, then?

{haiku}To lose so little,
with eyes of a predator!
A promised triumph.
My, ~name~... Is the steam from the bath too warm, or are you getting into this game more than you would like to admit?

{haiku}What gorgeous display
is your bare body next to
your slightly red cheeks.

{haiku}In every action,
you perform so boldly, and
oh-so-full of life! {!reset}
I can't help but admire the spectacle...
Ooh, those are pretty, but pretty impractical, too. I'd rather wear something comfortable; it would hardly be convenient to break an ankle on the battlefield.

{haiku}Stolen, mock luster;
by that false light you project
I won't be dazzled.
Hmm... one of the Hoshidan customs is taking your shoes when you visit someone else. Though I don't know if someone actually lives here...

{haiku} What a spectacle!
Your clothes, lying in tatters.
But won't you need those?
There's no need to take out your anger on your clothes, you know...
Huh... I must admit, I have grown too attached to my clothes to destroy them in a fit of anger...
Oh, you are taking off your ~clothing~? That's a shame, I was looking forward to see you forfeit with ~clothing.ifPlural(them|it)~ on...

{haiku}Sinful, strange journey;
relinquishing your footwear,
the initial step.
*yawn* And I woke up... for this? Ah, perhaps I shouldn't have bothered.
Maybe it's not too late to go back to sleep...
Lately, there has been somewhat of a trend of wearing glasses, back at the base. Purely cosmetic, but they do make you appear smarter.
Your glasses? I hope you didn't need them to see. Otherwise you won't get to see the rest of us anymore...
You didn't have to take everything off, you know? I'm pretty sure you could have kept your glasses...
Some people can be really averse to wearing shoes. My mother, for example; I don't think I have ever seen her wearing any.
To think of bringing a weapon to a friendly strip poker game... a rather bloodthirsty decision, ~name~.
Maybe I could count my writing implements as a layer? Oh, but then I couldn't write anymore... never mind.
Does something like your ~clothing~ count as a layer? It's not even a garment...
Normally, one's visage is visible from the start... but by wearing a mask, and then removing it, you created an interest on it. Hm...

{haiku}Faced against a crowd
she steadily marches on,
such valiant display!

{haiku}To nature's beauty
no man-made product compares
cute though it may be.
Ah, the inner turmoil! The conflict between instinct and duty! It's even more appealing than your ~clothing~...
Just so you know, by not removing your clothes, you are the one out of place, ~name~...

{haiku}Stripping your clothing
under a fully blue sky
a summer day's joy.

{haiku}An undressed body
pearls of sweat on its surface
the water beckons.

{haiku}By slowly stripping,
abandon your former self;
show us one more face.

{haiku} Faced with misfortune,
hate not the wind, spring blossoms,
for all things must end.

This room is quite boring... Were it not for the activity inside of it, there would be nothing remarkable to it.
{haiku} Breaking the routine
of the monochrome canvas,
a touch of color.
This darkness may slightly obscure your features... but where the light doesn't reach, my imagination does, ~name~.

{haiku}Predetermined loss;
a woman enchants the crowd,
a full moon watches.

Oh... this is not at all like looking at my mirror image...
{haiku}No mere copy,
with a spirit of her own
she unveils it all...

{haiku}Trapped with no escape
in a fair woman's embrace
paradise, or hell?
Huh... she might have been bothersome, but I wasn't expecting you to go that far, Tharja. Ah, well. Maybe now your bickering will cease.
Ah, I must admit you have a point there as well... I, too, am interested to see what this game holds in store for us.
Ah, you do have a point... However, if there can exist as many meanings as observers, can such a thing as a "true meaning" truly be reached by human perception?
So true! I mean, she puts a lot of thought into the potions she makes. In comparison, all I really have to do is wave a festal...
Well, at least that explains how a butterfly got inside in the first place.
And hey, your human form is even prettier than your butterfly one, if I say so myself.
Oh, but she is quick to return, too. Now the game can continue.
... Maybe he is some sort of river deity?

Ugh... At the very least, I would require a teacher...
{haiku}Why would I declare
a war on the endless filth?
Alone, I can't win...
A tempting offer, but I don't know if I would have accepted. As of late, I have felt an urge to travel around the world once I'm free from my duties.
Yeah, Selkie is not exactly what I have in mind when I think of a god. You, on the other hand...
Perhaps you should try to see things with a wider perspective. The people you are fighting may not have a choice, either.
Is standing in the nude part of your plan to mess with ~player~, then? How bold of you.

Ergh. That's... a point I cannot refute.
{haiku}Too many summers
sealed away in a cocoon,
untouched by the sun...
Hmm... With such an abundance of books within arm's reach, I assume you know many people interested in literature, ~name~.
Well, with haiku, you have no choice but to be precise... But out of curiosity, which do you favor yourself?

Oh, but that is exactly why I devote myself to poetry!
{haiku}From spring to winter,
every poem, a challenge
I accept with pride.
But aren't you afraid of devolving into meaninglessness?
The dungeon? Oh, I took you for a law-abiding citizen, but it seems appearances can be deceiving...
The way you describe this story, you seem charmed by it. Are you looking for a prince yourself, perhaps?
Ah, that's a shame. But maybe you can return with those friends of yours, reminisce a bit about the past... Could be nice.
O-oh... That brings to mind a particularly vivid image...
Ah, traditional medicine... honestly, healing with staves is better most of the time. And cheaper, too. How expensive are the potions of this Hourai person?
Indeed. I never expected that a deity with such a high status would show her privates to strangers for fun. Ah, what a wonderful world we live in...
Ah, in the end, I am but a humble shrine maiden. Pay these ramblings no mind.
Ah, so prideful, so self-assured! Certainly, the qualities of a god... good luck on your apotheosis, then.
To be torn from your quotidian pleasures by the cruel hand of fate... is not too dissimilar from my own circumstances. So not even the gods are free from such adversities, are they?
Interesting... I just hope your passion doesn't become corrupted by the need to be successful.
True, we are both blessed with beauty. Frankly, I'm surprised you have so much trouble finding somebody to marry.
Although, personally, I am more fond of rods than staves. I'd rather keep my distance, thank you very much.

{haiku}A genius maker
must have bestowed life on it
to achieve speech, too...
Yes, yes, very funny. You have shown off plenty, and luckily nobody was hurt as a result. Now let's not do that again, yes?
Wait... if she doesn't have clothes anymore, she can't use that gun of hers anymore! Yes! I survived strip poker against her!
Oh, uh... After the initial surprise, the juxtaposition of both male and female part is almost hypnotic... (Maybe if I asked Rhajat, she could...)

{haiku}Fret not, Misato:
battle scar; warrior's proof;
it just adds to you.
Oh, never mind. If you are alright, let's continue the game... without explosions involved, preferably.
Ah, so the cat ears were just part of the costume... I was under the impression you were some sort of cat-folk.
You have nothing to worry about, Cheryl. It might be classified as dark magic, but it works just like the magic I use to heal people.

Lust is truly powerful, isn't it?
{haiku}Accustomed to pain
the warrior's spirit succumbs
to pleasure instead...

Oh. Oh, my.
{haiku}My heart, overwhelmed
by your simple, pure beauty;
I count every beat
Oh? I didn't know you could wear more than one pair of underwear. My, this is more educational than I had expected.

{haiku}Trapped in an instant
a myriad white petals;
A man's underwear.
How strange, to ignore the identity of the very god you worship... And yet, you are still able to perform your duties. In the end, that's all that matters, isn't it?
Well, it may look unconventional, but I have seen my share of nonsensical weapons: umbrellas, hoes... Once, I think I even saw someone wielding a giant daikon radish.

Huh...
{haiku}My hunch went astray
a detective, I am not;
yet the riddle's solved.
Ah, so you came prepared... I'm not much of a swimmer myself, so I'd rather observe by the side.
An intimate encounter with an actual deity... I cannot wait to tell Father about this! Of course, the actual circumstances need not transpire.

{haiku}Light as a feather,
just from this gentle caress
I become aroused...

{haiku}I walk this lone path
and as my body grows weak,
my voice becomes song...
This might not be the purest of acts, but it is truly pleasing... perhaps, in part, due to its taboo nature.
I must admit, the atmosphere is not quite as propitious as it could be... but I'll make do with what I have.

{haiku}Though I don't need it,
assistance would be welcome...
a better view, please?
Haah... the warmth of the hearth cannot measure to what my own body is experiencing...
O-oh, f-fuck!
Haah... it seems words have left me...
Not... m-much longer...
I'm a-almost...
Hnrrgh...
I am making... such undignified noises... b-but I need it...
N-no... I can't hold myself... I d-don't want to!
Y-yes, that's it! O-ooh!
Whew, what a rush! I'm starting to get slightly drowsy...
Heh... I always get tired after doing this... today was no exception...
I wonder if this counted as exercise... I did end up working a sweat, heehee.
Maybe I should I have tried to prolong it... but I always get so excited, I end up losing control...
Doing it in front of an audience... went pretty well, actually. I'll probably do it again sometime.
That was so intense... I will need some time to get my thoughts in order...
*yawn*... I'm sure your story is fascinating, Cagliostro, but I'm too tired to pay attention... I think I'm going to take a quick nap...
The bed is right there... but I am too tired to get up. Ah, I'm afraid I will fall asleep on the spot...
*yawn*... This game is taking such a long time... I think I'm going to take a quick nap...

Ah... I really needed that nap...
{haiku}From a deep slumber
the poet's mind wakes refreshed:
and rising, takes flight.
As you just saw, I have the ability to fall asleep anywhere I wish. It's one of my best qualities, if I say so myself.

{haiku}An awakening:
to briefly stand between dreams
and reality...
This nap wasn't long enough to form any coherent dreams... but that is fine; my current situation surpasses any oneiric imagery I could conceive.
While I sleep, my dreams are indistinguishable from reality. It is only when I am awake that the illusion is dispelled. Could life itself, too, be nothing but a dream, then?
Ah... I often take naps outdoors, but this is the first time I have done so while nude. A pleasant experience, I must say.
I may have lost, but that was fun. Wait, if I had won, I wouldn't have been able to relieve myself, so maybe it was a good thing I didn't?
After the game, I'm locking myself in my room for a week. I have much to write about...
Normally, I would be taking a shower at this point. I suppose I will have to stay sticky a bit longer...
And to think I will have to return to the dull routine of training and chores after this...
Hmm... tomorrow, I'm on cooking duty. People always praise my meals, but I spend so much time making them when I could be writing instead...
So many haiku in so little time... This has certainly been a productive day!
Thank goodness I no longer have a hand to worry about! Now I can write to my heart's content...
An experience like this is truly unique... I doubt I will ever forget these feelings...

{haiku}From this adventure
I gained the perfect treasure:
a new perspective.

At this point, I can't lose anymore... all that I have left is observing and writing.
A fitting role, isn't it?
Ah, after the game ends I will have to put on my clothes again... I do hope I can clean up first, though.
For me, the game is already over... but feel free to continue watching me, if that's your wish.
There is no one I'm rooting for to win. My only hope left is for the end result to be interesting.
As far as I am concerned, winning or losing is irrelevant. Yet seeing you fret over your chances is amusing, I must admit.

{haiku}By capricious luck,
one lights up, freed from the dark.
But will it be you?
Until all but one are completely defeated, this will continue... Oh, but I am not in a hurry. Take as long as needed.
I'm almost out of paper to write down poems... Such fortunate misfortune is a rare experience for me.
Come to think of it, what prize does the winner get? Being the only one not to forfeit doesn't seem worthwhile to me...
Throwing myself off a cliff, participating in a strip poker game... Recently, I keep surprising myself, huh.
The forfeit's emotions are still fresh in my mind, ripples of pleasure coming through...
I doubt we will remember who won each round, but the feelings this game brings will remain for quite a long time nonetheless.
I wish I had brought something to eat... all this exercise has made me slightly peckish.
That girl kept watching all game long, in the end... She is persistent, if nothing else.
How carefree do you have to be to spend so long in idle observation? I wish I had as much free time as that girl behind the glass seems to have.
Can we eat the cake already? I'm getting hungry...
Here I stand, naked, sweaty and tired... The next step is pretty obvious, is it not?
When the game ends, I'll take the chance to soak for a while... You are welcome to join, if you are inclined to do so.
I think I'd rather not go into the water... by swimming skills are practically nonexistent, and the water is too salty.

{haiku}I may have prevailed,
yet I could not spoil myself.
It's almost unfair...

{haiku}Victory is mine!
But I barely broke a sweat...
What did just happen?

{haiku}It went by so fast...
Is it over already?
But I have yet to...
I had already seen my defeat as a given, since it's the most common outcome... And yet, fate surprises me with a win.
Ah, I won, but now I am all alone... Perhaps some kind person shall walk me home gently?
Meaningless though that may be, I find myself the winner... But what is my reward?
And so the game ends, with my modesty kept almost fully intact. This is a bit anticlimactic...
Haiku GET
O-oh, the game is over? Oh, uh, congratulations, ~winner~...
In the end, none of us could prevail... Well played indeed, ~player~.

{haiku}Strengthened by a friend
the bold warrior stands alone;
his foes, defeated.
Well, you won, Binah. I suppose I must congratulate you. And yet, you stand, with your desires unfulfilled... perhaps I could assist with that?
In the end, winning was the more unexpected move you could pull. Well played, Bobobo.

{haiku}Proud in victory,
the elven warrior stands
her hunger sated.

{haiku}Not only beauty;
luck, too, blesses your actions.
Congratulations.
I never thought I would see someone in control of their own destiny like you, ~target~. And yet, to use such a power to cheat in a game like this feels... wasteful, somehow.
We really had no chance from the start, huh? But I cannot be too angry; I did get what I wanted, after all...

{haiku}What I most enjoy;
a show, poems and a nap:
an excellent day.

{haiku}In this covert place,
a brief, yet pleasant sojourn,
I leave satisfied.

{haiku}Although a novice
to such a game, I was charmed;
I shall soon return.
Haiku GET
*yawn* Ah, the game is still going? Must have been a short nap, then...
*yawn* Oh, it's over already? I hope I didn't miss too much...
Zzzzzzzz...
Zzz...zzz...
Zzz...*snore* zzz...

{haiku}Lying down, I watch...
today's clouds slide to the right...
I truly am free...

{haiku}Haiku without end,
imperishable poet...
asleep, still I write...

{haiku} With closed eyes I see,
Elysium in the dream...
no turmoil, just peace...

{haiku} War, a paradox...
If no one calls for it, why?
Why must it return?

{haiku}We all need safety:
In the rough sea, a lighthouse
poems in the fog...

{haiku}In the darkest night,
a light parts the sky; go forth,
shining shooting star...

{haiku}I extend my hand
towards the most precious gem:
a full moon above...

{haiku}The birds fly back home
black kites over the sunset...
But who chases them?

{haiku}Fog rolled; all I see
is an endless blank expanse:
beauty painted white...

{haiku}As the days go by
I leisurely only write;
is this happiness?

{haiku}A transient respite
under a blanket of stars,
such good company!

{haiku}Glacial solitude;
time flows, yet I stay and watch
this world, unmoving.

{haiku} The seconds drag by
as I watch from my window
a spring painted gray.

{haiku}This lamp leads me home
undimmed by my fog-turned breath
light in starless sky.

{haiku}Seaside winter dawn;
nobody left to listen
when the seagulls cry.

{haiku}Drifting in a dream,
transient tranquility
away from this world.

{haiku}Unmoving, this bird,
is now prey for ants and flies,
for it could not fly.

{haiku}Cycle of seasons,
eternal transient reign;
all ends, all returns.

{haiku}Gold in a blue sky,
the rising, shrinking balloon;
a white-clad child cries.

{haiku}Lights and noise bombard
the once-peaceful summer sky;
birds flee, terrified.

{haiku}An infinite sea,
one hue permeates my sleep;
purple reverie...
